original: gsol // bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dus 'di nas bzung nas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du tshangs par spyod pa'i dge bsnyen la gnas pas rtsa ba'i dang po srog gcod pa dang / rtsa ba gnyis pa ma byin par len pa dang / gsum pa mi tshangs par sbyod pa dang /
analyzed: gsol // bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dus 'di nas bzung nas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du tshangs par spyod pa'i dge bsnyen la gnas pas rtsa ba'i dang po srog gcod pa dang / rtsa ba gnyis pa ma byin par len pa dang / gsum pa mi tshangs par sbyod pa dang /
translated: From this time forward, for as long as I live, I will abide in the celibate upāsaka precepts. I will abandon the first root nonvirtue, taking life, the second root nonvirtue, taking what is not given, the third root nonvirtue, impure conduct,

original: bzhin pa brdzun du smra ba dang / yan lag gi dang po myos pa'i chang dang / bcos pa'i chang dang / 'bru'i chang dag spangs nas slar ldog par bgyid pa lags so zhes re re la gsum gsum brjod na /
analyzed: bzhin pa brdzun du smra ba dang / yan lag gi dang po myos pa'i chang dang / bcos pa'i chang dang / 'bru'i chang dag spangs nas slar ldog par bgyid pa lags so zhes re re la gsum gsum brjod na /
translated: and the first branch nonvirtue, intoxicating and fermented liquors, and I will refrain from the second branch nonvirtue, eating at the wrong time.”

original: sdon gyi dgra bcom pa rnam skyi bslab pa la rjes su slob po //🔽rjes su sgrub bo //
analyzed: sdon gyi dgra bcom pa rnam skyi bslab pa la rjes su slob po // rjes su sgrub bo //
translated: The arhats of the past trained in the precepts.🔽They practiced them.

original: rjes su bgyid do //
analyzed: rjes su bgyid do //
translated: They followed them.

original: thabs yin no //
analyzed: thabs yin no //
translated: They were skillful.🔽They were excellent.

original: legs so // tshangs par spyod pa'i dge bsnyen du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: legs so // tshangs par spyod pa'i dge bsnyen du 'gyur ro //
translated: They became lay practitioners of pure conduct.

original: slob dpon gyis tshangs par spyod pa'i dge bsnyen du gzung du gsol //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis tshangs par spyod pa'i dge bsnyen du gzung du gsol //
translated: Master, please accept me as a lay practitioner of pure conduct.

original: dge tshul gyis kyang gzhin gong ltar mkhan po slob dpon dad pa'i dge 'dun gyi spyan sngar slob dpon dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: dge tshul gyis kyang gzhin gong ltar mkhan po slob dpon dad pa'i dge 'dun gyi spyan sngar slob dpon dgongs su gsol /
translated: The novice monk also says to the preceptor, master, and the Sangha of virtuous practitioners, “Master, please listen.

original: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dus 'di nas bzung nas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du dge tshul la gnas pas rtsa ba'i dang po srog gcod pa dang / gnyis pa ma byin par len pa dang / gsum pa mi tshangs par spyod pa dang / bzhi pa bardzun du smra ba dang /
analyzed: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dus 'di nas bzung nas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du dge tshul la gnas pas rtsa ba'i dang po srog gcod pa dang / gnyis pa ma byin par len pa dang / gsum pa mi tshangs par spyod pa dang / bzhi pa bardzun du smra ba dang /
translated: From this time forward, for as long as I live, I will abide as a novice monk. I will practice the first root precept of refraining from taking life, the second root precept of refraining from taking what is not given, the third root precept of refraining from impure conduct, the fourth root precept of refraining from false speech,

original: yan lag dang po 'bru'i chang dang / bcos pa'i chang dang myos par 'gyur ba dang / yan lag gnyis pa glu gar rtse 'jo dang // yan lag gsum pa rgyan dang kha dog 'chang ba dang / bzhi pa mal stan mthon po dang / lnga pa khri stan chen po dang /
analyzed: yan lag dang po 'bru'i chang dang / bcos pa'i chang dang myos par 'gyur ba dang / yan lag gnyis pa glu gar rtse 'jo dang // yan lag gsum pa rgyan dang kha dog 'chang ba dang / bzhi pa mal stan mthon po dang / lnga pa khri stan chen po dang /
translated: the fourth is to give up sleeping on high beds,🔽the fifth is to give up eating at improper times,🔽the sixth is to give up accepting gold and silver.

original: drug pa phyi dro'i kha zas dang / bdun pa gser dngul 'chang ba spangs nas slar ldog par bgyid lags so zhes re re la gsum gsum brjod do //
analyzed: drug pa phyi dro'i kha zas dang / bdun pa gser dngul 'chang ba spangs nas slar ldog par bgyid lags so zhes re re la gsum gsum brjod do //
translated: “I will give up these seven branches and turn away from them.”

original: sngon gyi zhes pa la sogs pa gong ltar brjod do //
analyzed: sngon gyi zhes pa la sogs pa gong ltar brjod do //
translated: “In the past…” and so forth, as above.

original: dge slong dngos kyi las kyi cho gas blang /
analyzed: dge slong dngos kyi las kyi cho gas blang /
translated: The actual monk vows are taken through the ritual of the rite.

original: 'dir skyabs dang legs par brjod pa gong ltar gsum brjod pa dang / gong gi rtsa ba bzhi dang / lhag ma dang ma nges pa gnyis dang ; spang ba'i ltung byed la sogs pa las ldog par brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir skyabs dang legs par brjod pa gong ltar gsum brjod pa dang / gong gi rtsa ba bzhi dang / lhag ma dang ma nges pa gnyis dang ; spang ba'i ltung byed la sogs pa las ldog par brjod do //
translated: Here, the refuge and the recitation of the virtues are done as above, and the four root vows, the two undetermined vows, and the vows of the downfalls that are to be abandoned are recited and turned away from.

original: gso sbyong zhes bya ba lo'am /
analyzed: gso sbyong zhes bya ba lo'am /
translated: “The purification and restoration” is done monthly,

original: zla ba'am nya stong gso zhing sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: zla ba'am nya stong gso zhing sbyong ba'o //
translated: One should observe and purify oneself on the day of the full moon or the new moon.

original: nyams pa yang bcos su yod pas kyang gso sbyong ngo //
analyzed: nyams pa yang bcos su yod pas kyang gso sbyong ngo //
translated: One should also observe and purify oneself on the day of the waning moon, because one’s vows may be damaged and need to be restored.

original: dus ma nges pa zla ba 'am lo tsam srung ba la yang gso zhing sbyong ba legs so //
analyzed: dus ma nges pa zla ba 'am lo tsam srung ba la yang gso zhing sbyong ba legs so //
translated: It is also good to observe and purify oneself on a day of the waxing moon, or even once a year.🔽Here, one should recite and accept the following until one reaches the essence of enlightenment:

original: 'dir @125b 'og gi theg pa gsum 'dod pas dus snying po byang chub la mchis kyi bar du brjod cing khas blang do //
analyzed: 'dir @125b 'og gi theg pa gsum 'dod pas dus snying po byang chub la mchis kyi bar du brjod cing khas blang do //
translated: “I will practice the three vehicles as taught by the Buddha.”

original: sems bskyed pa'i tshe 'og gi gdams ngag gis byang chub snying por shes par bstan par bya'o //🔽mngon nas kyang nyes pa skyes bas blta'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa'i tshe 'og gi gdams ngag gis byang chub snying por shes par bstan par bya'o // mngon nas kyang nyes pa skyes bas blta'o //
translated: When one generates the thought of awakening, one should recite the following instruction and demonstrate one’s understanding of the essence of enlightenment:🔽“I will not give up on the thought of awakening until I reach the essence of enlightenment.”

original: gsum pa chos la bslab pa la bzhi ste /
analyzed: gsum pa chos la bslab pa la bzhi ste /
translated: The third, the training in the Dharma, has four parts:

original: spyod lam dang / lta ba dang / bsgom pa dang / skyon spang ba'o //
analyzed: spyod lam dang / lta ba dang / bsgom pa dang / skyon spang ba'o //
translated: the conduct, the view, the meditation, and the elimination of faults.

original: spyod lam la bzhi ste /
analyzed: spyod lam la bzhi ste /
translated: The conduct has four parts:

original: bsnyen gnas pas spyad pa dang / dge bsnyen gyis spyad pa dang / dge tshul bas spyad pa dang / dge slong gis spyad pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen gnas pas spyad pa dang / dge bsnyen gyis spyad pa dang / dge tshul bas spyad pa dang / dge slong gis spyad pa'o //
translated: the conduct of the lay practitioner, the conduct of the novice, the conduct of the monk, and the conduct of the renunciate.

original: de la bsnyen gnas pas spyad pa ni kun du bzang po'i mdo las bsnyen gnas pa'i gang zag gis /
analyzed: de la bsnyen gnas pas spyad pa ni kun du bzang po'i mdo las bsnyen gnas pa'i gang zag gis /
translated: The practice for one-day vow holders is taught in the Sutra of Samantabhadra's Good Company:

original: de dus lus ngag yid kyis sgrim zhes pas lus kyis khrus dang phyag bya ba dang / ngag gis 'don pa dang / snying po bzlas pa dang / yid kyis nyes pa shes pas bslab pa bsrung ba'i sems dang / yon tan shes pas yi dam gyi lha dran pa dang /
analyzed: de dus lus ngag yid kyis sgrim zhes pas lus kyis khrus dang phyag bya ba dang / ngag gis 'don pa dang / snying po bzlas pa dang / yid kyis nyes pa shes pas bslab pa bsrung ba'i sems dang / yon tan shes pas yi dam gyi lha dran pa dang /
translated: At that time, with body, speech, and mind, be careful means that with the body, one should bathe, make prostrations, and so forth; with speech, recite scriptures and repeat the essence mantras; and with the mind, one should have the attitude of protecting the precepts by recognizing faults and should remember the meditation deity by recognizing good qualities.

original: lus ngag gis dge ba byas pa dang / bsrung ba'i nyi ma yid la bya ba'o //
analyzed: lus ngag gis dge ba byas pa dang / bsrung ba'i nyi ma yid la bya ba'o //
translated: One should also perform virtuous actions with body and speech and keep in mind the day of the vow.

original: dge bsnyen gyis spyad pa la byams pas zhus pa'i mdo nas /
analyzed: dge bsnyen gyis spyad pa la byams pas zhus pa'i mdo nas /
translated: The practice for lay practitioners is taught in the Sutra Requested by Maitreya:

original: dge bsnyen dad dang ldan pa yis //
analyzed: dge bsnyen dad dang ldan pa yis //
translated: A lay practitioner who has faith

original: las min spang zhing dge bcu bsnyen //
analyzed: las min spang zhing dge bcu bsnyen //
translated: should avoid unvirtuous actions and practice the ten virtues.

original: zhes pas ba lang dang / bya phyag gso ba la sogs pa bcu mya ngan las 'das pa'i nang nas bstan pa ltar spang ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pas ba lang dang / bya phyag gso ba la sogs pa bcu mya ngan las 'das pa'i nang nas bstan pa ltar spang ba'o //
translated: As it is taught in the Sutra of the Ten Dharmas, one should avoid the ten nonvirtues, such as raising cattle, keeping chickens, and so forth.

original: dge ba bcu ni kun dga' bos zhus pa'i mdo nas bstan pa ltar sbyad de /
analyzed: dge ba bcu ni kun dga' bos zhus pa'i mdo nas bstan pa ltar sbyad de /
translated: The ten virtues are to be practiced as taught in the Sutra Requested by Ananda.

original: srog bskyab pa dang / 'byor pa sbyin par gtang ba dag /
analyzed: srog bskyab pa dang / 'byor pa sbyin par gtang ba dag /
translated: They are: to save lives, to give wealth,

original: dkon mchog mchod pa dang / mchod rten dang / sku gzugs dang lha khang la sog pa la na bzang dbul ba dang / bskor ba dang / phyag dang / kha tog klug pa gdang / snying po dang bsod pa bya ba dang / zhig pa gso ba dang sku dkar byug pa dang /
analyzed: dkon mchog mchod pa dang / mchod rten dang / sku gzugs dang lha khang la sog pa la na bzang dbul ba dang / bskor ba dang / phyag dang / kha tog klug pa gdang / snying po dang bsod pa bya ba dang / zhig pa gso ba dang sku dkar byug pa dang /
translated: to make offerings to the Three Jewels, to offer good clothes, to circumambulate, to prostrate, to recite prayers, to make offerings, to repair what is broken, to make images,

original: nya mo btsun pa'i dge ba bya ba dang / 'os pa'i kha ma dang drin can la rim gro bya ba'o //
analyzed: nya mo btsun pa'i dge ba bya ba dang / 'os pa'i kha ma dang drin can la rim gro bya ba'o //
translated: to do virtuous deeds, and to serve those who are worthy, who are kind, and who are sick.

original: dge tshul gyis spyad pa la dge tshul dngos kyi 'dul bar blta'o //
analyzed: dge tshul gyis spyad pa la dge tshul dngos kyi 'dul bar blta'o //
translated: The practices of a novice monk are to be seen in the Vinaya of a novice monk.

original: 'dir k'a ri k'a nas /🔽nam gyi cha smad mal langs nas //
analyzed: 'dir k'a ri k'a nas / nam gyi cha smad mal langs nas //
translated: Here, from the Karika:🔽In the last part of the night, get up from bed,

original: nam langs btshar du kha ton bya //
analyzed: nam langs btshar du kha ton bya //
translated: and recite prayers at dawn.

original: gdong dang so yi dri bkrus la //
analyzed: gdong dang so yi dri bkrus la //
translated: Wash your face and teeth,

original: de bzhin gshegs la gus phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs la gus phyag 'tshal //
translated: and respectfully prostrate to the Tathagata.

original: zhes pas lus ngang yid kyis bya ba ste lus kyi nyes pa 'phel bar mi bya ba la @126a * //
analyzed: zhes pas lus ngang yid kyis bya ba ste lus kyi nyes pa 'phel bar mi bya ba la @126a * //
translated: This is the practice of body, speech, and mind.🔽There are four:🔽During the day, avoid non-Dharmic worldly activities.🔽At night, do not sleep until after the outer gate is opened.🔽When walking, be mindful of the precepts and walk like a bride.

original: bzhi ste / nyin par 'jig rten pa ma dad pa spad ba dang / mtshan mo phyi sgo phyin chad du mi nyal ba dang / 'gro ba'i tshe bslab pa dran pas bag ma ltar 'gro ba dang / za ba dang 'dug pa dag bag med par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bzhi ste / nyin par 'jig rten pa ma dad pa spad ba dang / mtshan mo phyi sgo phyin chad du mi nyal ba dang / 'gro ba'i tshe bslab pa dran pas bag ma ltar 'gro ba dang / za ba dang 'dug pa dag bag med par mi bya'o //
translated: When eating and sitting, do not be careless.

original: dge ba 'phel bas tho rangs srod tsog tsog po dang / khrus dang rten la phyag dus dang skabs su bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba 'phel bas tho rangs srod tsog tsog po dang / khrus dang rten la phyag dus dang skabs su bya'o //
translated: In order to increase virtue, sit up straight at dawn and dusk, bathe, and pay homage to the Three Jewels at the appropriate times.

original: ngag gis mi smra ba drug ste /
analyzed: ngag gis mi smra ba drug ste /
translated: There are six things not to say with the voice:🔽Do not speak out of ignorance, anger, or to find fault with others.

original: mi shes pa dang / mi khro ba dang / mtshang mi 'dru ba dang / phyar ka mi gtang ba dang / rta gad mi bya ba dang / gtsug lag khang dang dge 'dun mang po'i gseb tu gcam bskyung ba'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa dang / mi khro ba dang / mtshang mi 'dru ba dang / phyar ka mi gtang ba dang / rta gad mi bya ba dang / gtsug lag khang dang dge 'dun mang po'i gseb tu gcam bskyung ba'o //
translated: Do not speak sarcastically, laugh loudly, or flatter in the presence of the monastic community or the Three Jewels.

original: ngag gis brjod par bya ba kha don dang / klag pa dang / snying po brjod pa dang / bstod pas bstod pa dang / zhi bas blang ba dang / dang bas chos zhu ba dang drug go //
analyzed: ngag gis brjod par bya ba kha don dang / klag pa dang / snying po brjod pa dang / bstod pas bstod pa dang / zhi bas blang ba dang / dang bas chos zhu ba dang drug go //
translated: The six kinds of verbal worship are: chanting, reading, reciting the essence mantras, praising with hymns of praise, requesting the wheel of the doctrine to be turned, and requesting not to pass into nirvana.

original: yid la gnyis kyi nyes pa spang ba la yang gnyis te /
analyzed: yid la gnyis kyi nyes pa spang ba la yang gnyis te /
translated: The two kinds of mental worship are:

original: mchod rten dang / gtsug lag khang dang / dge 'dun gyi dkor la gnod sems dang / rku sems spang ba dang / bslab pa nyams pa'i nyes pa dran par byas la bslab pa bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: mchod rten dang / gtsug lag khang dang / dge 'dun gyi dkor la gnod sems dang / rku sems spang ba dang / bslab pa nyams pa'i nyes pa dran par byas la bslab pa bsrung ba'o //
translated: to abandon the two faults of the mind, and to remember the faults of the decline of the precepts and to guard the precepts.

original: yon tan dran pas bsam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: yon tan dran pas bsam pa lnga ste /
translated: The five kinds of worship by recollection of good qualities are:

original: lus ngag gi dge ba'i yon tan dran par bya ba dang / 'khor ba sdug bsngal bar shes par bya ba dang / byas pa mi rtag pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba dang / stong pa bdag med par shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: lus ngag gi dge ba'i yon tan dran par bya ba dang / 'khor ba sdug bsngal bar shes par bya ba dang / byas pa mi rtag pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba dang / stong pa bdag med par shes par bya ba'o //
translated: to remember the good qualities of physical and verbal virtue, to understand that cyclic existence is suffering, to understand that what is created is impermanent, to understand that nirvana is peace, and to understand that emptiness is the absence of self.

original: dge slong gi spyad pa la dge slong dngos dang / shes rab can gyis 'drul bar yang blta'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi spyad pa la dge slong dngos dang / shes rab can gyis 'drul bar yang blta'o //
translated: In the case of a monk's conduct, the monk should be considered in terms of his actual status and his wisdom.

original: 'dir lha'i dbang pos zhus pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'dir lha'i dbang pos zhus pa'i mdo las /
translated: Here, the Sūtra of the Questions of the Lord of Gods states:

original: dge slong rnams kyis bya ba ni //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bya ba ni //
translated: The duties of monks are

original: mi dge bcu spang dge bcu bsgrub //
analyzed: mi dge bcu spang dge bcu bsgrub //
translated: to abandon the ten nonvirtues and accomplish the ten virtues.

original: de yang lus ngag yid kyis te //
analyzed: de yang lus ngag yid kyis te //
translated: Moreover, this is done with body, speech, and mind.

original: ma yengs spyong lam rnam bzhir sbyod //
analyzed: ma yengs spyong lam rnam bzhir sbyod //
translated: One engages in the four paths of training without distraction.

original: ces pa dang / dgyes pa'i rdo rje nas /
analyzed: ces pa dang / dgyes pa'i rdo rje nas /
translated: The Hevajra Tantra states:

original: de nas bslab pa'i gnas bcu po zhes pas /
analyzed: de nas bslab pa'i gnas bcu po zhes pas /
translated: Then, the ten precepts.

original: dge ba bcu bsgrub ste /
analyzed: dge ba bcu bsgrub ste /
translated: Thus, one accomplishes the ten virtues.

original: de yang mi dge ba bcu mi 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang mi dge ba bcu mi 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to prevent the ten nonvirtues from increasing,🔽the Sūtra of the Questions of Aṅgulimāla states:

original: dga' bos zhus pa de nyid las mi dge ba bcu 'phel bas dge slong rnams nyes byed bcu spongs shig / bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: dga' bos zhus pa de nyid las mi dge ba bcu 'phel bas dge slong rnams nyes byed bcu spongs shig / bcu gang zhe na /
translated: Because the ten nonvirtues increase, monks should abandon the ten misdeeds. What are the ten?

original: srog gcod pa'i nyes byed ma bsams par dge slong rnams lus kyi bya ba byed pa dang / ma byin par len pa'i nyes byed gzhan gyi gzugs kyi yul la reg pa dang / mi changs par sbyod pa'i nyes byed bud med kyi yul lnga la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: srog gcod pa'i nyes byed ma bsams par dge slong rnams lus kyi bya ba byed pa dang / ma byin par len pa'i nyes byed gzhan gyi gzugs kyi yul la reg pa dang / mi changs par sbyod pa'i nyes byed bud med kyi yul lnga la spyod pa dang /
translated: The misdeed of killing is to kill a monk without thinking about it; the misdeed of stealing is to touch the objects of another’s form; the misdeed of sexual misconduct is to engage in the five objects of women;

original: brdzun gyi nyes @126b byed ma bsams par smra ba dang / phra ma'i nyes byed mang bar smra ba dang / ngag 'khyal pa'i nyes byed bre mor smra ba dang / tshig rtsub mo'i nyes byed mi dga' bar smra ba dang / brnab sems kyi nyes byed bdag la dgos sems 'chang ba dang /
analyzed: brdzun gyi nyes @126b byed ma bsams par smra ba dang / phra ma'i nyes byed mang bar smra ba dang / ngag 'khyal pa'i nyes byed bre mor smra ba dang / tshig rtsub mo'i nyes byed mi dga' bar smra ba dang / brnab sems kyi nyes byed bdag la dgos sems 'chang ba dang /
translated: the misdeed of lying is to speak without thinking; the misdeed of divisive speech is to speak much; the misdeed of senseless speech is to speak nonsense; the misdeed of harsh words is to speak unpleasantly; the misdeed of covetousness is to think of what is needed for oneself;

original: gnod sems kyi nyes byed gzhan la log par sbyod pa'o //
analyzed: gnod sems kyi nyes byed gzhan la log par sbyod pa'o //
translated: the misdeed of malice is to engage in the wrong conduct of others.

original: log par lta ba'i nyes byed dngos po la chags pa rnams spongs shig ces bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: log par lta ba'i nyes byed dngos po la chags pa rnams spongs shig ces bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: The misdeed of wrong view is to abandon attachment to things.

original: mi dge bcu 'gags pas mi dge ba dang bral nas dge bcur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mi dge bcu 'gags pas mi dge ba dang bral nas dge bcur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By stopping the ten nonvirtues, one becomes free from nonvirtue and becomes virtuous.

original: de ni bslab pa'i gnas bcu zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bslab pa'i gnas bcu zhes pa'o //
translated: These are called the ten points of training.

original: de nas bye brag pa la bslab ces pa la yang de nyid nas /
analyzed: de nas bye brag pa la bslab ces pa la yang de nyid nas /
translated: Next, the training in the Vaiṣṇava [system] is also as stated in the same text:

original: dge bcu rgyas phyir chos gnyis dang // spyod lam bzhi ru dge slong spyod //
analyzed: dge bcu rgyas phyir chos gnyis dang // spyod lam bzhi ru dge slong spyod //
translated: In order to expand the ten virtues, the monk practices the two dharmas and the four modes of conduct.

original: ces pas / de yang chos gnyis po nyes pa dang / mi dge ba spyod lam rnam bzhis mi byed pa dang / yon tan dge ba 'phel ba spyod lam bzhis bya ba ste /
analyzed: ces pas / de yang chos gnyis po nyes pa dang / mi dge ba spyod lam rnam bzhis mi byed pa dang / yon tan dge ba 'phel ba spyod lam bzhis bya ba ste /
translated: That is, the two dharmas are not engaging in faults and non-virtue through the four modes of conduct, and engaging in the four modes of conduct that increase virtuous qualities.

original: de yang de nyid nas /
analyzed: de yang de nyid nas /
translated: Moreover, it is stated in the same text:

original: dge slong byang chub sems ldan pas //
analyzed: dge slong byang chub sems ldan pas //
translated: The monk endowed with the mind of awakening

original: rtag tu dben par bsdad par bya //
analyzed: rtag tu dben par bsdad par bya //
translated: should always abide in solitude.

original: sems kyis bdag gzhan don byed la //
analyzed: sems kyis bdag gzhan don byed la //
translated: With the mind, he accomplishes the welfare of self and others;

original: dge slong zhes ni ngas brjod do //
analyzed: dge slong zhes ni ngas brjod do //
translated: I declare him to be a monk.

original: zhes pas de yang sems gnyis bskyed nas theg pa gsum dang ldan zhing dben par gnas nas mi dge ba mi 'byung zhing dge ba 'phel te /
analyzed: zhes pas de yang sems gnyis bskyed nas theg pa gsum dang ldan zhing dben par gnas nas mi dge ba mi 'byung zhing dge ba 'phel te /
translated: Having generated the two minds, possessing the three vehicles, abiding in solitude, non-virtue does not arise and virtue increases.

original: gal te gzhan don sems kyis byed kyang dngos su mi nus pa dang / dben par mi gnas pas 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: gal te gzhan don sems kyis byed kyang dngos su mi nus pa dang / dben par mi gnas pas 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: If you are unable to do this in actuality because of your concern for others, then you should do it in the following way.

original: spyod lam bzhis mi bya ba la gnyis te /
analyzed: spyod lam bzhis mi bya ba la gnyis te /
translated: There are two things that you should not do with the four types of physical behavior:

original: yid kyis dran pa lus kyis mi bya ba dang / ngag gis mi bya ba dang / lus kyis gzhi la sdod pa dang / 'gro ba dang / zas za ba'i tshe dang / nyal ba'i dus so //
analyzed: yid kyis dran pa lus kyis mi bya ba dang / ngag gis mi bya ba dang / lus kyis gzhi la sdod pa dang / 'gro ba dang / zas za ba'i tshe dang / nyal ba'i dus so //
translated: you should not do them with your body, speech, or mind.

original: sdod pa la nyes pa 'byung ba dang / nyes pa chen po 'byung nas bsdad pa gnyis kyi nyes pa 'byung bas mi bsdad pa la bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: sdod pa la nyes pa 'byung ba dang / nyes pa chen po 'byung nas bsdad pa gnyis kyi nyes pa 'byung bas mi bsdad pa la bcu gnyis te /
translated: There are twelve things that you should not do while sitting, because they lead to problems or serious problems.

original: 'greng ba dang / lho rgyal dang / snyes pa dang / khyi tshugs dang / sa rko ba dang / rts'a gcod pa dang / chu dang / me dang / khyi dang / bu chung la rtse ba dang / 'jig rten dang bud med nang du sdod pa spang ba'o //
analyzed: 'greng ba dang / lho rgyal dang / snyes pa dang / khyi tshugs dang / sa rko ba dang / rts'a gcod pa dang / chu dang / me dang / khyi dang / bu chung la rtse ba dang / 'jig rten dang bud med nang du sdod pa spang ba'o //
translated: You should not sit in a way that leads to problems: standing, lying on your right side, lying on your back, lying on your stomach, sitting like a dog, digging in the ground, cutting grass, playing with water, playing with fire, playing with dogs, playing with children, or sitting with worldly people or women.

original: nyes pa chen po 'byung bas mi bsdad pa la gnyis te /
analyzed: nyes pa chen po 'byung bas mi bsdad pa la gnyis te /
translated: There are two things that you should not do while sitting, because they lead to serious problems.

original: bsdad sa min pa dang / rten no //
analyzed: bsdad sa min pa dang / rten no //
translated: It is not a place to stay.

original: rten la dgu /
analyzed: rten la dgu /
translated: There are nine bases.

original: mchod rten dang / lha khang dang / sku gzugs dang / glegs bam dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / @127a * //
analyzed: mchod rten dang / lha khang dang / sku gzugs dang / glegs bam dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / @127a * //
translated: They are a stupa, a temple, an image, a book, an abbot, a master,

original: dge 'dun dang / pha ma dang / rgyal po dang / rgan po'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun dang / pha ma dang / rgyal po dang / rgan po'o //
translated: a saṅgha, one’s parents, a king, and an elder.

original: bsdad sa min pa la gnyis te /
analyzed: bsdad sa min pa la gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of places not to stay.

original: g-yas dang mdun du mi bsdad pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas dang mdun du mi bsdad pa'o //
translated: Do not stay to the right or in front.

original: 'gro ba la gnyis kyi nyes pa 'byung bas mi 'gro ba la bcu bdun te /🔽mu stegs dang 'grogs te mi 'gro / rgyug cing rgyug cing mi 'gro /🔽mu stegs kyi nang du mi 'gro / sgyu ma mkhan dang mi 'grogs nang du mi 'gro / de bzhin du tshong ba dang mi 'grogs nang du mi 'gro / dmag dang mi 'grogs nang du mi 'gro / shan pa dang smad 'tshong ma dang mi 'grogs nang
analyzed: 'gro ba la gnyis kyi nyes pa 'byung bas mi 'gro ba la bcu bdun te / mu stegs dang 'grogs te mi 'gro / rgyug cing rgyug cing mi 'gro / mu stegs kyi nang du mi 'gro / sgyu ma mkhan dang mi 'grogs nang du mi 'gro / de bzhin du tshong ba dang mi 'grogs nang du mi 'gro / dmag dang mi 'grogs nang du mi 'gro / shan pa dang smad 'tshong ma dang mi 'grogs nang
translated: There are seventeen things not to do when going because of the faults of the two kinds of going.🔽Do not go in the company of tīrthikas; do not go running and rushing;

original: du mi 'gro / bud med dang mi 'grogs nang du mi 'gro //
analyzed: du mi 'gro / bud med dang mi 'grogs nang du mi 'gro //
translated: do not go among tīrthikas; do not go in the company of magicians; do not go inside with them; likewise, do not go in the company of merchants; do not go inside with them; do not go in the company of soldiers; do not go inside with them; do not go in the company of butchers and prostitutes; do not go inside with them; do not go in the company of women; do not go inside with them.

original: phyogs su lta ba dang yul yengs pas mi 'gro / gos med pa dang / stod gos med pa dang / gzhan yang rtsod pa'i sar mi 'gro ba dang / 'jigs pa dang / don med pa dang / yang ba dang mi 'grogs /
analyzed: phyogs su lta ba dang yul yengs pas mi 'gro / gos med pa dang / stod gos med pa dang / gzhan yang rtsod pa'i sar mi 'gro ba dang / 'jigs pa dang / don med pa dang / yang ba dang mi 'grogs /
translated: One should not go to a place where there is a dispute, or to a place where there is fear, or to a place where there is no purpose, or to a place where there is no companion, or to a place where there is no support.

original: yang ba'i sar mi 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: yang ba'i sar mi 'gro ba'o //
translated: One should not go to a place where there is no support.

original: nyes pa chen po 'byung bas mi bya ba gnyis te /
analyzed: nyes pa chen po 'byung bas mi bya ba gnyis te /
translated: There are two things that should not be done because of the arising of a great fault.

original: rten gong ltar dgu /
analyzed: rten gong ltar dgu /
translated: The basis is the same as above.

original: mi 'gro ba lnga /
analyzed: mi 'gro ba lnga /
translated: There are five things to which one should not go.

original: dngos sam grib ma la mi 'gom /
analyzed: dngos sam grib ma la mi 'gom /
translated: One should not step on the actual or the shadow of a stupa.

original: g-yon bstan la mi 'gro / steng nas mi 'gro / mdun nas mi 'gro / rjes non pas mi 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: g-yon bstan la mi 'gro / steng nas mi 'gro / mdun nas mi 'gro / rjes non pas mi 'gro ba'o //
translated: One should not go to a place where there is a left-hand path, or to a place where there is a high place, or to a place where there is a front, or to a place where there is a back.

original: ngag la yid kyis zin par bya ste /
analyzed: ngag la yid kyis zin par bya ste /
translated: One should hold the speech with the mind.

original: mi smra ba la bzhi ste /
analyzed: mi smra ba la bzhi ste /
translated: There are four things to which one should not speak.

original: sngod pa'i tshe mi smra ba la gnyis te /
analyzed: sngod pa'i tshe mi smra ba la gnyis te /
translated: There are two things to which one should not speak when one is angry.

original: nyes pa dang nyes pa chen po las mu stegs la sogs pa bden yang mi smra ba dang / 'dri ba'i lan 'debs pa dang / zhi ba dang 'jam pa dang / ngal bas smra ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa dang nyes pa chen po las mu stegs la sogs pa bden yang mi smra ba dang / 'dri ba'i lan 'debs pa dang / zhi ba dang 'jam pa dang / ngal bas smra ba'o //
translated: One should not speak to a heretic, etc., about a fault or a great fault, even if it is true, or one should speak a reply to a question, or one should speak with a peaceful and gentle voice, or one should speak with a voice that is tired.

original: nyes pa chen po 'byung bas mi smra ba la gsum ste /
analyzed: nyes pa chen po 'byung bas mi smra ba la gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of faults:

original: 'greng ste sngod pa la sogs pas chos mi bshad pa dang / mchod rten la sogs pa la rgyu 'bras la skur ba dang / bre mo'i gtam mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'greng ste sngod pa la sogs pas chos mi bshad pa dang / mchod rten la sogs pa la rgyu 'bras la skur ba dang / bre mo'i gtam mi bya'o //
translated: Do not teach the Dharma while standing, laughing, and so forth; do not denigrate cause and effect in relation to stupas and so forth; do not engage in frivolous conversation.

original: brdzun sogs gong du bkag pa rnams kyang smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: brdzun sogs gong du bkag pa rnams kyang smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: Do not speak falsely, and so forth, as previously prohibited.

original: 'gro ba la yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: 'gro ba la yang de bzhin te /
translated: Also, do not do these things while walking.

original: za ba dang nyal ba la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: za ba dang nyal ba la yang de bzhin no //
translated: Do not do these things while eating or sleeping.

original: nyes pa dang / nyes pa chen po dag shes te smra ba'i tshod rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyes pa dang / nyes pa chen po dag shes te smra ba'i tshod rig par bya'o //
translated: Know the faults and the great faults, and be moderate in speech.

original: lus kyis zas za ba'i tshe na yang gnyis te /🔽nyes pa shi shu ste /
analyzed: lus kyis zas za ba'i tshe na yang gnyis te / nyes pa shi shu ste /
translated: When eating food with the body, there are two:🔽The fault is to eat while standing, laughing, and so forth;

original: 'greng ba la sogs pa bcus mi bza' ba dang / 'gro zhing mi bza' ba dang / smra zhing dang / kham che ba dang / chung ba dang / 'gram pa g-yas g-yon spo ba dang / rgan smras dang / rings pas dang / 'phro gcod pa dang /
analyzed: 'greng ba la sogs pa bcus mi bza' ba dang / 'gro zhing mi bza' ba dang / smra zhing dang / kham che ba dang / chung ba dang / 'gram pa g-yas g-yon spo ba dang / rgan smras dang / rings pas dang / 'phro gcod pa dang /
translated: do not eat while standing, walking, talking, with a large mouthful, with a small mouthful, shifting from side to side, with the mouth full, quickly, or interrupting.

original: ma 'grangs @127b par dang / yang pa'i sar za ba spang ba'o //
analyzed: ma 'grangs @127b par dang / yang pa'i sar za ba spang ba'o //
translated: Not to eat on a place that is not level, and not to eat on a place that is not covered.

original: nyes pa chen po 'byung bas spang ba la lnga //
analyzed: nyes pa chen po 'byung bas spang ba la lnga //
translated: There are five to abandon because a great fault arises.

original: dkon mchog la bsngos pa za ba dang / mkhan po dang slob dpon la dad pas bsngos pa za ba dang / pha dang ma la bsngos pa za ba dang / gtor ma dang byin gyis rlob pa za ba dang / rgyal po dang grong dpon la bsngos pa za ba spang ba'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog la bsngos pa za ba dang / mkhan po dang slob dpon la dad pas bsngos pa za ba dang / pha dang ma la bsngos pa za ba dang / gtor ma dang byin gyis rlob pa za ba dang / rgyal po dang grong dpon la bsngos pa za ba spang ba'o //
translated: Not to eat what has been dedicated to the Three Jewels, not to eat what has been dedicated with faith to the preceptor or master, not to eat what has been dedicated to one’s father and mother, not to eat what has been dedicated to the king or the head of a town, and not to eat what has been dedicated to the sacrificial fire.

original: nyal ba'i tshe'i lus la yang gnyis te /
analyzed: nyal ba'i tshe'i lus la yang gnyis te /
translated: There are two to the time of lying down.

original: nyes pa la dgu ste /
analyzed: nyes pa la dgu ste /
translated: There are nine faults.

original: gan rkyal du mi nyal /
analyzed: gan rkyal du mi nyal /
translated: Not to lie on one’s back,

original: kha bub dang / gos med pa dang / dbang po lag pas gzung ba dang / nub tu mgo bstan pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i grong dang / 'jig rten pa'i mi mang po nang dang / nad 'phal pa'i sa dang / grogs med par mi nyal ba'o //
analyzed: kha bub dang / gos med pa dang / dbang po lag pas gzung ba dang / nub tu mgo bstan pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i grong dang / 'jig rten pa'i mi mang po nang dang / nad 'phal pa'i sa dang / grogs med par mi nyal ba'o //
translated: not to lie face down, not to lie naked, not to hold the sense organs with the hands, not to point the head to the west, not to lie in a worldly town, not to lie in the midst of many worldly people, not to lie on a place that is damp with disease, and not to lie down without a companion.

original: nyes pa chen po 'byung bas mi nyal ba la gsum ste /
analyzed: nyes pa chen po 'byung bas mi nyal ba la gsum ste /
translated: There are three not to lie down because a great fault arises.

original: gong gi lha khang la sogs pa'i rten du 'os pa'i steng dang / rkang pa bstan pa dang / rgyab bstan pas mi nyal ba'o //
analyzed: gong gi lha khang la sogs pa'i rten du 'os pa'i steng dang / rkang pa bstan pa dang / rgyab bstan pas mi nyal ba'o //
translated: One should not sleep on the upper part of a temple, etc., which is suitable as a support, or with one's feet or back exposed.

original: na'am sa ye ma rnyed dam /
analyzed: na'am sa ye ma rnyed dam /
translated: If one cannot find a place to practice the purificatory fast,

original: srog gi bar chad du 'gyur ram dbang med na /
analyzed: srog gi bar chad du 'gyur ram dbang med na /
translated: or if one's life is in danger, or if one is powerless,

original: mdo bzang po 'phel ba nas /
analyzed: mdo bzang po 'phel ba nas /
translated: then one should recite the excellent sutras.

original: dang po pa yi chos rnams ni //
analyzed: dang po pa yi chos rnams ni //
translated: The first of the Dharmas

original: bar chad med par shes byas la //
analyzed: bar chad med par shes byas la //
translated: should be known as uninterrupted.

original: gso sbyong bya zhing bslab pa bsrung //
analyzed: gso sbyong bya zhing bslab pa bsrung //
translated: One should practice the purificatory fast and guard the precepts.

original: rim gyis rim gyis goms te bla //
analyzed: rim gyis rim gyis goms te bla //
translated: Gradually, gradually, one should become accustomed to the highest.

original: zhes pa dang / gso sbyong bya zhing skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes pa dang / gso sbyong bya zhing skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: And: One should practice the purificatory fast and apply it to the occasion.

original: bye brag kho na dbang du byas nas 'dod pa dang / dus gnyis su bsdus te /
analyzed: bye brag kho na dbang du byas nas 'dod pa dang / dus gnyis su bsdus te /
translated: In particular, it is summarized in two: desire and time.

original: 'dod pa sangs rgyas dang / sdom pas rgan pa la phyag byed pa dang / lus ngag gi dge ba rang gi don du 'dod pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'dod pa sangs rgyas dang / sdom pas rgan pa la phyag byed pa dang / lus ngag gi dge ba rang gi don du 'dod pa gnyis so //
translated: Desire refers to the two: desiring the Buddha and the elders who possess vows, and desiring one's own benefit through virtuous actions of body and speech.

original: dus la gsum ste /
analyzed: dus la gsum ste /
translated: Time is threefold:

original: dus 'di ji srid 'tsho'i bar dang / lam skye ba bdun dang / 'bras bu bskal pa gcig nas chos ston pa'i dus so //
analyzed: dus 'di ji srid 'tsho'i bar dang / lam skye ba bdun dang / 'bras bu bskal pa gcig nas chos ston pa'i dus so //
translated: The time is for as long as one lives, the path is seven lifetimes, and the result is the time of teaching the dharma after one eon.🔽Here, it is said:

original: 'dir / chos kyi dbyings la dbyer med phyir //
analyzed: 'dir / chos kyi dbyings la dbyer med phyir //
translated: Because the dharmadhātu is undifferentiated,

original: theg pa gsum du dbyer med kyang //
analyzed: theg pa gsum du dbyer med kyang //
translated: the three vehicles are undifferentiated.

original: gtso bos theg pa gsum bstan pa //
analyzed: gtso bos theg pa gsum bstan pa //
translated: The principal one taught the three vehicles

original: nga yi thabs la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: nga yi thabs la mkhas pa'o //
translated: as my skillful method.

original: zhes pas theg pa gsum la gnas par bya zhing /
analyzed: zhes pas theg pa gsum la gnas par bya zhing /
translated: Since one should abide in the three vehicles and

original: sdom pa gsum dang ldan par byas pas yon tan dang dge ba 'phel ba'i phyir sbyor lam bzhis sbyad par bya ba yang sdod pa la sogs pa thun bzhir bsgrub ste /
analyzed: sdom pa gsum dang ldan par byas pas yon tan dang dge ba 'phel ba'i phyir sbyor lam bzhis sbyad par bya ba yang sdod pa la sogs pa thun bzhir bsgrub ste /
translated: increase one’s qualities and virtues by possessing the three vows, one should practice the four preparations of the path of preparation in four sessions, such as the morning session.

original: snga dro'i thun la gsum ste /
analyzed: snga dro'i thun la gsum ste /
translated: The morning session has three parts:

original: ldang ba la sbyor ba dang / dngos dang / mjug gsum ste /
analyzed: ldang ba la sbyor ba dang / dngos dang / mjug gsum ste /
translated: the preparation, the actual session, and the conclusion.

original: sbyor ba yid ngag lus gsum @128a * //
analyzed: sbyor ba yid ngag lus gsum @128a * //
translated: The preparation is the three: mind, speech, and body.

original: ste ; yod sngon yang le lo dang gnyid kho na la brten nas 'di 'dra'o zhes bsams te nam smad ldang ngo //
analyzed: ste ; yod sngon yang le lo dang gnyid kho na la brten nas 'di 'dra'o zhes bsams te nam smad ldang ngo //
translated: Having relied on laziness and sleep alone, one thinks, “It is like this,” and one gets up at dawn.

original: gang gi na /
analyzed: gang gi na /
translated: In what?

original: na mo buddh'a ya /
analyzed: na mo buddh'a ya /
translated: Homage to the Buddha!

original: na mo manydzu shr'i /
analyzed: na mo manydzu shr'i /
translated: Namo Mañjuśrī.

original: na mo badzra p'a ni /
analyzed: na mo badzra p'a ni /
translated: Namo Vajrapāṇi.

original: na mo lo ke shva r'a ya /
analyzed: na mo lo ke shva r'a ya /
translated: Namo Lokīśvara.

original: na ma:t'a ra /
analyzed: na ma:t'a ra /
translated: Namo Tārā.

original: zhes rang gi yi dam gyi lha bskul lo //
analyzed: zhes rang gi yi dam gyi lha bskul lo //
translated: Thus, one invokes one's chosen deity.

original: lus dal nas tsog tsog tu ldang ngo //
analyzed: lus dal nas tsog tsog tu ldang ngo //
translated: When the body is relaxed, one rises up cross-legged.

original: dngos lus legs par langs la stod gos dang smad gos bgo ba dang / ngag snying po sgra dang bcas pas sprul dang sems can bskrad pa dang / yid dge ba bya ba'i phyir chos dran pa'o //
analyzed: dngos lus legs par langs la stod gos dang smad gos bgo ba dang / ngag snying po sgra dang bcas pas sprul dang sems can bskrad pa dang / yid dge ba bya ba'i phyir chos dran pa'o //
translated: Having risen well with the body, one puts on the upper and lower garments, and with the sound of the essence mantra, one expels snakes and sentient beings, and one is mindful of the Dharma in order to do virtuous things with the mind.

original: mjug le lo dang the tshom med pa'o //
analyzed: mjug le lo dang the tshom med pa'o //
translated: At the end, one is without laziness and doubt.

original: khrus la yang sbyor ba dngos mjug gsum ste /
analyzed: khrus la yang sbyor ba dngos mjug gsum ste /
translated: Also, with regard to bathing, there is the preparation, the actual [practice], and the conclusion.

original: sbyor ba bshang ba che chung dang / snabs lud sems can la gnod pa dang / sa min sar mi 'dor zhing legs par byas pa dang / chu srog chags dang dri ma med pas snod bkang ba dang / bkru sa yang mi gnod pa dang /
analyzed: sbyor ba bshang ba che chung dang / snabs lud sems can la gnod pa dang / sa min sar mi 'dor zhing legs par byas pa dang / chu srog chags dang dri ma med pas snod bkang ba dang / bkru sa yang mi gnod pa dang /
translated: The preparation is to defecate and urinate, and to expel mucus and phlegm that harm sentient beings, and to do it well without discarding it on the ground or in the water, and to fill the vessel with water that is free of living beings and impurities, and the place for washing is also not harmful.

original: sa ma yin par bkru ba dang / chu byin gyis brlab pa chu snod de'i chu la aa dkar po bsams la //
analyzed: sa ma yin par bkru ba dang / chu byin gyis brlab pa chu snod de'i chu la aa dkar po bsams la //
translated: The water is blessed by visualizing a white A in the water of the water vessel.

original: aa'i 'od kyis 'phags pa sbyan ras gzigs sbyan drangs te /
analyzed: aa'i 'od kyis 'phags pa sbyan ras gzigs sbyan drangs te /
translated: The light of the A invites Arya Avalokiteshvara.

original: mdun na gsal ba'i 'od kyis phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad sbyan drangs te /
analyzed: mdun na gsal ba'i 'od kyis phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad sbyan drangs te /
translated: The light of the clear figure in front invites all the Buddhas of the ten directions.

original: sbyan ras gzigs lta bur gyur pas nam mkha' khengs pa phyag mtshan kun de'i mthus sngar gyi chus bkang nas 'o ma ltar bdud rtsi'i chur gyur par bsams te bkru'o //
analyzed: sbyan ras gzigs lta bur gyur pas nam mkha' khengs pa phyag mtshan kun de'i mthus sngar gyi chus bkang nas 'o ma ltar bdud rtsi'i chur gyur par bsams te bkru'o //
translated: The space is filled with Avalokiteshvaras. The implements of all of them become nectar water through the power of the water.

original: bkru ba dngos ni aom ma ni padme sva bh'a ba h'um /
analyzed: bkru ba dngos ni aom ma ni padme sva bh'a ba h'um /
translated: The actual washing is done by reciting Om mani padme svabhava hum.

original: zhes brjod cing kha dang lag pa dang / gdong bkru'o //
analyzed: zhes brjod cing kha dang lag pa dang / gdong bkru'o //
translated: Recite this and wash the mouth, hands, and face.

original: yid kyis sgrib pa gnyis sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang / byin gyis brlabs pa chu dang ; sngags kyi nus pas dag par bsam mo //
analyzed: yid kyis sgrib pa gnyis sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang / byin gyis brlabs pa chu dang ; sngags kyi nus pas dag par bsam mo //
translated: Mentally, the two obscurations are purified by the power of the Buddhas, the blessing of the water, and the power of the mantra.

original: mjug mdun gyis sangs rgyas rnams gzhan don la slar gshegs par bsam mo //
analyzed: mjug mdun gyis sangs rgyas rnams gzhan don la slar gshegs par bsam mo //
translated: At the end, imagine that the Buddhas return to their own places in order to benefit others.

original: rang nyid pa dang sgrib pa dag pas dge ba byas par gnas par gnas par bam zhing don che bar bsam mo /
analyzed: rang nyid pa dang sgrib pa dag pas dge ba byas par gnas par gnas par bam zhing don che bar bsam mo /
translated: One should think that one is abiding in the place of the virtuous one who has purified obscurations, and that one is abiding in the place of the one who has done virtue.🔽The practice of Dharma has five parts:

original: chos sbyad pa la bsam gtan dang / kha ton dang / chu sbyin dang / 'byung bo la gtor ma gtang ba dang / mandal bya ba dang lnga'o //
analyzed: chos sbyad pa la bsam gtan dang / kha ton dang / chu sbyin dang / 'byung bo la gtor ma gtang ba dang / mandal bya ba dang lnga'o //
translated: meditation, recitation, water offerings, giving sacrificial cakes to the spirits, and making maṇḍalas.

original: bsam gtan la yang gsum ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan la yang gsum ste /
translated: There are three parts to meditation:

original: sbyor ba lus cog cog gam skyil krung du bsdang / ngag aom a'a:h'um zhes brjod /
analyzed: sbyor ba lus cog cog gam skyil krung du bsdang / ngag aom a'a:h'um zhes brjod /
translated: The preparation is to sit with the body straight or in the full lotus position, and to say “oṃ āḥ hūṃ” with the voice.

original: yid aom gyi 'od kha dog lngas /
analyzed: yid aom gyi 'od kha dog lngas /
translated: The mind is the five-colored light of oṃ.

original: dngos po sangs rgyas kyi sku'i ngo bor byas /
analyzed: dngos po sangs rgyas kyi sku'i ngo bor byas /
translated: The essence of the entity is the form of the Buddha.

original: aa:'i 'od @128b dkar pos sku'i ngo bo de sangs rgyas kyi gsung dang ldan par byas /
analyzed: aa:'i 'od @128b dkar pos sku'i ngo bo de sangs rgyas kyi gsung dang ldan par byas /
translated: The white light of āḥ endows the essence of the form with the speech of the Buddha.

original: h'um gi 'od nag po des sku gsung gi ngo bo de thugs dang ldan par byas te /
analyzed: h'um gi 'od nag po des sku gsung gi ngo bo de thugs dang ldan par byas te /
translated: The black light of hūṃ endows the essence of the body and speech with the mind.

original: thams cad mnyam por bsgrubs gnas dang bdag dang ting nge 'dzin dag ste bsrung bar yang de 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad mnyam por bsgrubs gnas dang bdag dang ting nge 'dzin dag ste bsrung bar yang de 'gyur ro //
translated: All are accomplished equally.

original: de nas bsam gtan dngos rtogs pa dang man ngag dang yid mos pa la thun dang nus tshad du gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bsam gtan dngos rtogs pa dang man ngag dang yid mos pa la thun dang nus tshad du gnas par bya'o //
translated: Then, for the actual meditative concentration, one should abide in the sessions and the extent of the power of realization, esoteric instructions, and mental aspiration.

original: kha don la lnga ste /
analyzed: kha don la lnga ste /
translated: The five for the oral recitation are:

original: bar chad zhi bar bya ba'i phyir gtsug tor dang / rdo rje rnam par 'joms pa gdon //
analyzed: bar chad zhi bar bya ba'i phyir gtsug tor dang / rdo rje rnam par 'joms pa gdon //
translated: For the sake of pacifying obstacles, recite the uṣṇīṣa and the Vajravidāraṇa dhāraṇī.

original: sgrib pa bal zhing dge ba bsdu pa'i phyir ltung bshags gdon /
analyzed: sgrib pa bal zhing dge ba bsdu pa'i phyir ltung bshags gdon /
translated: For the sake of purifying obscurations and gathering virtue, recite the Confession of Downfalls.

original: dge brgyas bar bya ba'i phyir byams pa dang sbyan ras gzigs dang ; bzang sbyod kyi smon lam lam gdon /
analyzed: dge brgyas bar bya ba'i phyir byams pa dang sbyan ras gzigs dang ; bzang sbyod kyi smon lam lam gdon /
translated: For the sake of increasing virtue, recite the aspirations of Maitreya, Avalokiteśvara, and Bhadracārya.

original: dge ba mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir shes rab snying po gdon /
analyzed: dge ba mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir shes rab snying po gdon /
translated: For the sake of not diminishing virtue, recite the Heart of the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: bstan pa rgyas par bya ba'i phyir 'jam dpal gyi mtshan brjod dang / mgon po nag po'i mdo gdon no //
analyzed: bstan pa rgyas par bya ba'i phyir 'jam dpal gyi mtshan brjod dang / mgon po nag po'i mdo gdon no //
translated: For the sake of the flourishing of the teachings, recite the Praise of Mañjuśrī’s Qualities and the Sūtra of the Black Protector.

original: de yang gtsug tor rgyal ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: de yang gtsug tor rgyal ba'i mdo las /
translated: Moreover, the Uṣṇīṣavijayā-sūtra states:

original: bgegs rnams gtsug tor rdo rjes 'joms //
analyzed: bgegs rnams gtsug tor rdo rjes 'joms //
translated: The obstacles are destroyed by the uṣṇīṣa vajra.

original: kun du dge ba zhus pa yis //
analyzed: kun du dge ba zhus pa yis //
translated: The one who is completely virtuous recites

original: sgrib sel bsong nams sdud pa dang // byams pa smon dang bzang por sbyod //
analyzed: sgrib sel bsong nams sdud pa dang // byams pa smon dang bzang por sbyod //
translated: Loving Kindness, Aspiration, and Good Conduct.

original: dge ba rgyas phyir nga yis bskul //
analyzed: dge ba rgyas phyir nga yis bskul //
translated: I urge you to increase virtue.🔽The perfection of wisdom is the heart

original: shes rab pha rol phyin de dag / de rnams kun gyi snying po brjod //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin de dag / de rnams kun gyi snying po brjod //
translated: of all of them.🔽Mañjuśrī increases the teachings,

original: bstan pa rgyas byed 'jam dpal dang // dal khas blangs mgon nag po //
analyzed: bstan pa rgyas byed 'jam dpal dang // dal khas blangs mgon nag po //
translated: and the pledged protector Kṛṣṇa🔽The preparation is visualizing the deities in front,🔽and the actual [offering] is making the offering without interruption,

original: zhes so // de la yang sbyor ba lta rnams mdun du gsal ba dang / dag pa dang gsal ba dang bar ma chod par gdon pa dngos dang / yon tan la the tshom mi za ba dngos so //
analyzed: zhes so // de la yang sbyor ba lta rnams mdun du gsal ba dang / dag pa dang gsal ba dang bar ma chod par gdon pa dngos dang / yon tan la the tshom mi za ba dngos so //
translated: and not doubting the qualities.

original: rgyas par bshad pa'i sbyor ba dngos mjug kyang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par bshad pa'i sbyor ba dngos mjug kyang shes par bya'o //
translated: The extensive explanation of the preparation, actual [offering], and conclusion should also be understood.

original: chu sbyin ni rten snod du gzhag ba'am /
analyzed: chu sbyin ni rten snod du gzhag ba'am /
translated: For the water offering, place the support in a vessel

original: med na yang ngang yi dam gyi lha gang yin pa der bsgoms la /
analyzed: med na yang ngang yi dam gyi lha gang yin pa der bsgoms la /
translated: or, if there is none, meditate on it as the pledged deity.

original: aom a'a:h'um brjod pas h'um gi 'od des snod kun stong par bsam /
analyzed: aom a'a:h'um brjod pas h'um gi 'od des snod kun stong par bsam /
translated: Recite Oṃ āḥ hūṃ, and imagine that the light from the hūṃ fills the vessel.

original: stong pa las pam las padma ser po 'dab ma brgyad pa /
analyzed: stong pa las pam las padma ser po 'dab ma brgyad pa /
translated: From emptiness, a yellow eight-petaled lotus arises from paṃ.

original: de'i lte ba la aa las zla ba rgyas pa 'od dang bcas pa /
analyzed: de'i lte ba la aa las zla ba rgyas pa 'od dang bcas pa /
translated: In its center, from a yellow jam, is a full moon with light.

original: de'i steng du dzam ser 'od dang bcas pa /
analyzed: de'i steng du dzam ser 'od dang bcas pa /
translated: Upon that, from a yellow jam, is a yellow Jambhala with light.

original: dzam de gyur pa las nor sbyin ser po padma dang zla ba'i steng du g-yas brkyang ba'i 'o ga na yid bzhin gyi nor bu mnan pa /
analyzed: dzam de gyur pa las nor sbyin ser po padma dang zla ba'i steng du g-yas brkyang ba'i 'o ga na yid bzhin gyi nor bu mnan pa /
translated: That Jambhala transforms into a yellow Jambhala on a lotus and moon, his right leg extended, pressing on a wish-fulfilling jewel.

original: g-yon bkum pa'i pus mo'i 'og na rin po che sna tshogs kyi bum pa mnan pa /
analyzed: g-yon bkum pa'i pus mo'i 'og na rin po che sna tshogs kyi bum pa mnan pa /
translated: His left leg is bent, pressing on a vase filled with various jewels.

original: mdog ser po gser bsregs pa 'dra ba /
analyzed: mdog ser po gser bsregs pa 'dra ba /
translated: His color is yellow like refined gold.

original: ral ba gyen du brdzes nas rin po che'i ze prog can /🔽zhal rnam @129a * //
analyzed: ral ba gyen du brdzes nas rin po che'i ze prog can / zhal rnam @129a * //
translated: His hair is tied up in a topknot with a jewel.

original: par snang mdzad ltar mdangs dang ldan pa /🔽snyan cha mgul rgyan /
analyzed: par snang mdzad ltar mdangs dang ldan pa / snyan cha mgul rgyan /
translated: His face is radiant like Vairocana.🔽He has earrings, a necklace,

original: dbu rgyan phyag gdub /
analyzed: dbu rgyan phyag gdub /
translated: a crown, bracelets,

original: zhabs gdub rin po che sna tshogs kyis byas pa gcig bsgoms la /
analyzed: zhabs gdub rin po che sna tshogs kyis byas pa gcig bsgoms la /
translated: and anklets made of various jewels.

original: de'i thugs ka na padmo'i steng na zla ba /
analyzed: de'i thugs ka na padmo'i steng na zla ba /
translated: Meditate on him with a moon on a lotus in his heart.

original: de'i steng na dzam ser po yong pa des rang bzhin gyi nor lha de nyid 'dra ba sbyan drangs te dngos sam yid kyis mchod sbyin phul la bdag gzhan gyi 'dod pa skongs shig ces brjod de /
analyzed: de'i steng na dzam ser po yong pa des rang bzhin gyi nor lha de nyid 'dra ba sbyan drangs te dngos sam yid kyis mchod sbyin phul la bdag gzhan gyi 'dod pa skongs shig ces brjod de /
translated: On top of that, a yellow Jam appears. That invokes the very same natural wealth deity. Make offerings to it, either in actuality or mentally, and say, “Fulfill the wishes of myself and others.”

original: de la bcug la gnyis med du gyur pa'i thugs ka'i zla ba'i jam gis phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' sbyan drangs te mchod pa rnams kyis mchod nas dbang mnos rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de la bcug la gnyis med du gyur pa'i thugs ka'i zla ba'i jam gis phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' sbyan drangs te mchod pa rnams kyis mchod nas dbang mnos rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Then, with that, the Jam on the moon at the heart of the deity and wealth deity become nondual. Invite the buddhas and bodhisattvas of the ten directions with the Jam. Make offerings with the offerings. Take empowerment.

original: sbyor ba des nor sbyin bskyed nas chu snod chu dang bcas pa la sngon du bstan pa'i khrus kyi skabs ltar byin gyis brlabs la sbyor ba de dang ldan pas sbyin pa dngos g-yas pa'i sor mo las bdud rtsi'i rgyun gyis sbyin pa //
analyzed: sbyor ba des nor sbyin bskyed nas chu snod chu dang bcas pa la sngon du bstan pa'i khrus kyi skabs ltar byin gyis brlabs la sbyor ba de dang ldan pas sbyin pa dngos g-yas pa'i sor mo las bdud rtsi'i rgyun gyis sbyin pa //
translated: Then, with that yoga, generate wealth. Consecrate the water vessel with water as in the section on bathing as previously explained. With that yoga, give the actual gift.

original: aom dzam bha la dza landra ye sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom dzam bha la dza landra ye sv'a h'a /
translated: Om Jambhala Jalendra svaha.

original: zhes brgya rtsa brgyad spyin no //
analyzed: zhes brgya rtsa brgyad spyin no //
translated: Recite this one hundred and eight times.

original: mjug bdag gi 'dod pa skongs par gyis shig ces brjod la chu de gtsang sar bskyal lo //
analyzed: mjug bdag gi 'dod pa skongs par gyis shig ces brjod la chu de gtsang sar bskyal lo //
translated: Finally, say, “Fulfill my wishes,” and carry the water to a clean place.

original: de yang sangs rgyas bya rgod phyang po'i ri la bzhugs pa la /
analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas bya rgod phyang po'i ri la bzhugs pa la /
translated: Furthermore, when the Buddha was staying at Vulture Peak,

original: lha sbyin gyis brag 'phangs pa la phyag na rdo rjes rdo rje 'phangs pas brag phyed mar chad pa las /
analyzed: lha sbyin gyis brag 'phangs pa la phyag na rdo rjes rdo rje 'phangs pas brag phyed mar chad pa las /
translated: Devadatta threw a rock at him. Vajrapāṇi threw a vajra at the rock, and it broke in half.

original: phyed kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi mthe bong la bzhar phyed kyis nor sbyin gyi mgo bkas pas sangs rgyas kyi 'khor thams cad bred pa la /
analyzed: phyed kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi mthe bong la bzhar phyed kyis nor sbyin gyi mgo bkas pas sangs rgyas kyi 'khor thams cad bred pa la /
translated: One half struck the Blessed One’s toe, and the other half struck Devadatta’s head. All the Buddha’s followers were terrified.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhal nas 'u cag gnyis la kho'i de tsam gyi lan chags pas mi dga' ma byed cig / khyod la ngas phan gdags so zhes brjod nas gong ltar bkrus pas sos te ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhal nas 'u cag gnyis la kho'i de tsam gyi lan chags pas mi dga' ma byed cig / khyod la ngas phan gdags so zhes brjod nas gong ltar bkrus pas sos te ;
translated: The Buddha said, “Do not be upset. He and I have a karmic debt from the past. I will help you.” He washed the toe as described above, and it healed.🔽Then the Buddha said to Devadatta, “From now on, give up your wealth and generate the awakening mind.” Devadatta went for refuge and generated the awakening mind.

original: 'gro ba la phyin chad nor sbyin par byang chub tu sems bskyed nas phyir bas kyi gang zag chos la mos pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis chu sbyin zhing //
analyzed: 'gro ba la phyin chad nor sbyin par byang chub tu sems bskyed nas phyir bas kyi gang zag chos la mos pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis chu sbyin zhing //
translated: Those who have faith in the Dharma should give water in this way.

analyzed: nor sbyin gyis nor sbyin par sangs rgyas kyi sbyan sngar dam bcas pa'o //

analyzed: rang yi dam gyi lhar gsal bas aom a'a:h'um brjod pas h'um gi 'od sngon pos stong par byas /

analyzed: a'a:pa'i 'od dkar pos snod bcud du bcas pa rgya che zhing zab pa'i bdud rtsir gyur te /

analyzed: btang ba dngos la lag pa g-yas pa'i sor mo lnga las kyang bdud rtsi dkar me re re 'bab par bsams la /
translated: The

original: nam:sa ma nta buddh'a n'am /
analyzed: nam:sa ma nta buddh'a n'am /
translated: Namasamantabuddhānām.

original: sarba ta th'a ga ta aa ba lo ki te aom sam bta ra sam bha ra h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: sarba ta th'a ga ta aa ba lo ki te aom sam bta ra sam bha ra h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Sarvatathāgatāvalokite om sambhara sambhara hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: zhes lan gsum brjod cing /
analyzed: zhes lan gsum brjod cing /
translated: Recite this three times.

original: g-yas pas se gol lan gsum brdabs la sbyin no //
analyzed: g-yas pas se gol lan gsum brdabs la sbyin no //
translated: Snap one's fingers three times with the right hand and give it.

original: mjug gtsang sar bskyal ba dang / der tshogs pa'i 'byung po rnams 'grangs ngoms te chos la dad bar bsam mo //
analyzed: mjug gtsang sar bskyal ba dang / der tshogs pa'i 'byung po rnams 'grangs ngoms te chos la dad bar bsam mo //
translated: At the end, take it to a clean place, and think that the spirits who have gathered there are satisfied and content and have faith in the Dharma.

original: de yang sangs rgyas rgyal byed kyi tshal na bzhugs pa la ma ga dh'ar khyim bdag phung po dge zhes bya bas sangs rgyas 'khro bcas sbyan drangs nas chos ston drangs te slar bshegs so /
analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas rgyal byed kyi tshal na bzhugs pa la ma ga dh'ar khyim bdag phung po dge zhes bya bas sangs rgyas 'khro bcas sbyan drangs nas chos ston drangs te slar bshegs so /
translated: Moreover, when the Buddha was staying in the Jeta Grove, in Magadha the householder named Saṃgata invited the Buddha and his retinue, and after the Buddha taught the Dharma, he departed.

original: phyi de lo dus khyim bdag de ltogs par gyur te /
analyzed: phyi de lo dus khyim bdag de ltogs par gyur te /
translated: The following year, on that day, the householder became hungry,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sbyan sngar phyin te dris pa la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sbyan sngar phyin te dris pa la /
translated: and when he went before the Buddha and asked about it,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhal nas 'phags pa sbyan ras gzigs la zhus zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhal nas 'phags pa sbyan ras gzigs la zhus zhes bstan nas /
translated: the Buddha said, Ask Ārya Avalokiteśvara.

original: khyim bdag gis 'phags pa sbyan ras gzigs la zhus pas //
analyzed: khyim bdag gis 'phags pa sbyan ras gzigs la zhus pas //
translated: The householder asked Ārya Avalokiteśvara,🔽and he said,

original: khyod kyis snga ma mchod pa'i yi dags dang 'byung po skal ba bcad pas nyes te /
analyzed: khyod kyis snga ma mchod pa'i yi dags dang 'byung po skal ba bcad pas nyes te /
translated: You have made a mistake by offering the first torma to the hungry ghosts and spirits.

original: da 'id bzhin du yi dags sgo drung na yod pa dang / gzhan dag la yang gtor ma 'di ltar byin zhes gong gi de bstan bas de slar sngon bzhin 'byor pa dang ldan par gyur to //
analyzed: da 'id bzhin du yi dags sgo drung na yod pa dang / gzhan dag la yang gtor ma 'di ltar byin zhes gong gi de bstan bas de slar sngon bzhin 'byor pa dang ldan par gyur to //
translated: Now, give the torma to the hungry ghost in front of the door and to the others as well, and he showed him the above torma ritual. The hungry ghost became as wealthy as before.

original: phyi rabs kyi gang zag chos la dad pa rnams kyang 'byung po 'i gtor ma la brtson pas yi dags la phan pa dang / bdag gi 'byor pa mi nyams pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rabs kyi gang zag chos la dad pa rnams kyang 'byung po 'i gtor ma la brtson pas yi dags la phan pa dang / bdag gi 'byor pa mi nyams pa'o //
translated: Also, for the people of future generations who have faith in the Dharma, by striving in the torma offering to the spirits, it will benefit the hungry ghosts and prevent the loss of one's own wealth.

original: mandal la yang gsum ste /
analyzed: mandal la yang gsum ste /
translated: There are three types of mandalas:

original: yid du 'ong pa'i sa la khru gang las mi chung ba'i gru bzhi la sogs pa byas te /
analyzed: yid du 'ong pa'i sa la khru gang las mi chung ba'i gru bzhi la sogs pa byas te /
translated: The pleasing earth is not less than one cubit in size, with four sides, and so forth.

original: sbyor ba chu gtsang ma dang me tog dang dris byug pa dang / aom a'a:badzra bh'u mi h'um /🔽zhes brjod cing sa byugs pas /
analyzed: sbyor ba chu gtsang ma dang me tog dang dris byug pa dang / aom a'a:badzra bh'u mi h'um / zhes brjod cing sa byugs pas /
translated: The preparation is to anoint it with clean water, flowers, and perfume, and recite: Oṃ āḥ vajra bhūmi haṃ.

original: rdo rje'i sa bzhir bsam pa dang / aom a'a:badzra re khe h'um zhes brjod la /
analyzed: rdo rje'i sa bzhir bsam pa dang / aom a'a:badzra re khe h'um zhes brjod la /
translated: By reciting this, imagine that the earth becomes the vajra ground, and recite: Oṃ āḥ vajra rekhe hūṃ.

original: re kh'a bskor bas rgya che ba'i gzhal yas su bsam pa dang / aom a'a:badzra mandal h'um zhes brjod la snyoms par byugs pas rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor du byugs par bsams la /
analyzed: re kh'a bskor bas rgya che ba'i gzhal yas su bsam pa dang / aom a'a:badzra mandal h'um zhes brjod la snyoms par byugs pas rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor du byugs par bsams la /
translated: Having swept the area, one should imagine that the area is a vast celestial mansion.🔽Reciting Oṃ āḥ vajra maṇḍala hūṃ, one should smear the area with the mixture, imagining that the area is smeared with the vajra mandala.

original: aom a'a:badzra re khe h'um zhes brjod de bsrung ba gzhan pas rdo rje'i srung @130a * //
analyzed: aom a'a:badzra re khe h'um zhes brjod de bsrung ba gzhan pas rdo rje'i srung @130a * //
translated: Reciting Oṃ āḥ vajra rekhā hūṃ, one should draw the boundary lines, imagining that the area is protected by the vajra enclosure.

original: bas bgegs bskrad par bsam pa dang / lag pa bkru pa'o //
analyzed: bas bgegs bskrad par bsam pa dang / lag pa bkru pa'o //
translated: One should wash one’s hands.

original: dbul ba dngos la mandal la dbul ba dang / mandal dbul ba gnyis so //🔽mandal la dbul ba ni me tog tshom bu dgu dbus dang shar gyi rim pas phyogs dang mtshams su bkod la skad cig gam rim gyis mtsho las padma 'dab ma stong dang ldan pa lte ba na zla ba'i gdan la lha so so'i dam tshig pa sa bon
analyzed: dbul ba dngos la mandal la dbul ba dang / mandal dbul ba gnyis so // mandal la dbul ba ni me tog tshom bu dgu dbus dang shar gyi rim pas phyogs dang mtshams su bkod la skad cig gam rim gyis mtsho las padma 'dab ma stong dang ldan pa lte ba na zla ba'i gdan la lha so so'i dam tshig pa sa bon
translated: The actual offering has two parts: offering the maṇḍala and offering to the maṇḍala.🔽Offering to the Maṇḍala🔽For the offering to the maṇḍala, arrange nine heaps of flowers in the center and east, in order, in the cardinal and intermediate directions.

original: nam mngon byang lngas /
analyzed: nam mngon byang lngas /
translated: Instantly or gradually, imagine that from the lake arises a lotus with a thousand petals, in the center of which is a moon seat upon which is the individual seed syllable of each deity.

original: sgrub thabs ltar bskyed la /
analyzed: sgrub thabs ltar bskyed la /
translated: From that arises the pledge being, which is the form of the deity.

original: de'i 'od kyis ye shes sems dpa' bkug cing bstim la bsgom ste /🔽aom badzra pushpe a'a:h'um phat sv'ah'a /
analyzed: de'i 'od kyis ye shes sems dpa' bkug cing bstim la bsgom ste / aom badzra pushpe a'a:h'um phat sv'ah'a /
translated: The light from that invokes the gnosis beings, who dissolve into the visualized forms.🔽oṃ vajra puṣpe aḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā

original: aom badzra d'i pe a'a:h'um phat sv'a h'a /🔽aom badzra gandhe a'a:h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom badzra d'i pe a'a:h'um phat sv'a h'a / aom badzra gandhe a'a:h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: oṃ vajra dīpe aḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā🔽oṃ vajra gandhe aḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā

original: aom badzra nee bi dye a'a:h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom badzra nee bi dye a'a:h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: oṃ vajra naividye aḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā

original: aom badzra gandha le a'a:h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom badzra gandha le a'a:h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: oṃ vajra gandhale aḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā

original: zhes brjod la gzugs la sogs pa dngos sam yid kyis mchod pa dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang / sdig pa bshags pa dang / 'jig rten gyi dge ba la yi rang ba dang / de'i dge ba bsngo ba dang / gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: zhes brjod la gzugs la sogs pa dngos sam yid kyis mchod pa dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang / sdig pa bshags pa dang / 'jig rten gyi dge ba la yi rang ba dang / de'i dge ba bsngo ba dang / gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang /
translated: Recite these mantras and make offerings of forms and so forth, either in actuality or mentally, as well as prostrations, confession of negative actions, rejoicing in the world’s virtue, dedicating the virtue of that, going for refuge to the Three Jewels,🔽offering one’s body, generating bodhicitta, exhorting, supplicating, and dedicating virtue.

original: lus dbul ba dang / sems bskyed pa dang / bskul ba dang / gsol ba gdab pa dang / bdag gi dge ba'i las rnams 'di dag gis /
analyzed: lus dbul ba dang / sems bskyed pa dang / bskul ba dang / gsol ba gdab pa dang / bdag gi dge ba'i las rnams 'di dag gis /
translated: Through these virtuous actions of mine,

original: ab dru du ni myur du sangs rgyas shog /'gro la phan phyir chos rnams ston bgyid cing //
analyzed: ab dru du ni myur du sangs rgyas shog /'gro la phan phyir chos rnams ston bgyid cing //
translated: may I quickly become a buddha and teach the Dharma for the benefit of migrating beings.

original: sems can sdug bsngal mang pos gzir ba sgrol //
analyzed: sems can sdug bsngal mang pos gzir ba sgrol //
translated: I will liberate sentient beings tormented by many sufferings.

original: zhes smon lam gdab pa ni mjug go //
analyzed: zhes smon lam gdab pa ni mjug go //
translated: The conclusion is to make the aspiration prayer.

original: mandal dbul ba la yang gnyis te /
analyzed: mandal dbul ba la yang gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of offering mandalas:

original: dkon mchog sbyi dang / bla ma la dbul ba'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog sbyi dang / bla ma la dbul ba'o //
translated: the general offering to the Three Jewels and the offering to the guru.

original: sbyi la dbul ba ni ji ltar mdzes par bya ste /
analyzed: sbyi la dbul ba ni ji ltar mdzes par bya ste /
translated: The general offering is to make it as beautiful as possible,

original: dngos sam yid gyis dngos po gzugs la sogs pa lus ngang bcas pa dbul ba dang / mjug bdun rnam par dag pa dang / smon lam gong ltar gdab bo //
analyzed: dngos sam yid gyis dngos po gzugs la sogs pa lus ngang bcas pa dbul ba dang / mjug bdun rnam par dag pa dang / smon lam gong ltar gdab bo //
translated: offering with one’s body and possessions, such as material things, forms, and so on, either in actuality or imagined, and at the end, the seven-branch service and the aspiration prayers as above.

original: bla ma la dbul ba ni /
analyzed: bla ma la dbul ba ni /
translated: The offering to the guru is as follows.

original: aom ham ma h'a me re be na ma:/
analyzed: aom ham ma h'a me re be na ma:/
translated: Recite Oṃ haṃ mahāmerubhūmi namo.

original: zhes brjod pas mandal gyi dkyil du bzhag la ri rab tu bsam /
analyzed: zhes brjod pas mandal gyi dkyil du bzhag la ri rab tu bsam /
translated: Place it in the center of the mandala and imagine it as Mount Meru.

original: aom yam p'u rba bi de ha ya na ma:/
analyzed: aom yam p'u rba bi de ha ya na ma:/
translated: Recite Oṃ yaṃ pūrvavideha namo.

original: zhes pas shar gyi gling du bsam //🔽aom ram dzam bu dv'i p'a ya na ma:zhes brjod pas lho'i gling chags par bsam /
analyzed: zhes pas shar gyi gling du bsam // aom ram dzam bu dv'i p'a ya na ma:zhes brjod pas lho'i gling chags par bsam /
translated: Imagine that the eastern continent is formed.🔽Recite Oṃ raṃ jambudvīpa namo.🔽Imagine that the southern continent is formed.🔽Recite Oṃ laṃ aparagodānīya namo.

original: aom lam aa ba ra d'a n'i yan ma:zhes brjod pas nub kyi gling du chags par bsam /
analyzed: aom lam aa ba ra d'a n'i yan ma:zhes brjod pas nub kyi gling du chags par bsam /
translated: Imagine that the western continent is formed.

original: aom bam autta ra be na ma:zhes pas byang gi gling du chags pa'o //
analyzed: aom bam autta ra be na ma:zhes pas byang gi gling du chags pa'o //
translated: With Om vam uttarabodhinam, it is placed in the northern continent.

original: aom ya:au pa dv'i @130b p'a ya na ma:zhes pas shar lhor gzhag / aom ra:au pa dv'i p'a ya na ma:zhes pas lho nub tu gzhag / aom la:au pa dv'i p'a ya na ma:zhes pas nub byang du gzhag / aom ba:au pa dv'i p'a ya na ma:zhes byang
analyzed: aom ya:au pa dv'i @130b p'a ya na ma:zhes pas shar lhor gzhag / aom ra:au pa dv'i p'a ya na ma:zhes pas lho nub tu gzhag / aom la:au pa dv'i p'a ya na ma:zhes pas nub byang du gzhag / aom ba:au pa dv'i p'a ya na ma:zhes byang
translated: With Om yom upadvipayanamas, it is placed in the southeast; with Om ram upadvipayanamas, it is placed in the southwest; with Om lam upadvipayanamas, it is placed in the northwest; with Om vam upadvipayanamas, it is placed in the northeast.

original: shar du gzhag / aom ya:aa shva ratn'a ya na ma:zhes pas shar gyi gling du rta rin po chas gang bar bsam /
analyzed: shar du gzhag / aom ya:aa shva ratn'a ya na ma:zhes pas shar gyi gling du rta rin po chas gang bar bsam /
translated: With Om yom asharatnayanamas, one imagines that the eastern continent is filled with the precious horse.

original: aom ra:ma niratn'a ya na ma:zhes pas lhor nor bu rin po ches gang bar bsam /
analyzed: aom ra:ma niratn'a ya na ma:zhes pas lhor nor bu rin po ches gang bar bsam /
translated: With Om ram maniratnayanamas, one imagines that the southern continent is filled with the precious jewel.

original: aom la:ha sti ratn'a yan ma:/
analyzed: aom la:ha sti ratn'a yan ma:/
translated: With Om lam hastiratnayanamas,

original: zhes brjod pas byang du glang po chas gang bar bsam /
analyzed: zhes brjod pas byang du glang po chas gang bar bsam /
translated: one imagines that the northern continent is filled with the precious elephant.

original: aom ba:pu ru sha ratn'a ya na ma:zhes pas nub tu blon pos pos gang bar bsam /
analyzed: aom ba:pu ru sha ratn'a ya na ma:zhes pas nub tu blon pos pos gang bar bsam /
translated: With Om vam purusharatnayanamas, one imagines that the western continent is filled with the precious minister.

original: aom ya:khadga ratn'a ya na ma :zhes pas shar lhong dmag dpon gyis gang bar bsam /
analyzed: aom ya:khadga ratn'a ya na ma :zhes pas shar lhong dmag dpon gyis gang bar bsam /
translated: Think that the southeast is filled with the army chief.🔽Om ram satri ratna ayana ma.

original: aom ra:str'i ratn'a ya na ma:zhes pas lho nub tu btsun mos gang bar bsam //
analyzed: aom ra:str'i ratn'a ya na ma:zhes pas lho nub tu btsun mos gang bar bsam //
translated: Think that the southwest is filled with the queen.🔽Om lam cakra ratna ayana ma.

original: aom la:tsa kra ratn'a ya na ma:zhes brjod pas nub byang du 'khro los gang bar bsam /
analyzed: aom la:tsa kra ratn'a ya na ma:zhes brjod pas nub byang du 'khro los gang bar bsam /
translated: Think that the northwest is filled with the wheel.🔽Om vam sarva nidhi bhyo na ma.

original: aom ba sarba ni dhi bhyo na ma:zhes pas byang shar du gzhag pas rin po che sna tshogs kyis gang bar bsam /
analyzed: aom ba sarba ni dhi bhyo na ma:zhes pas byang shar du gzhag pas rin po che sna tshogs kyis gang bar bsam /
translated: Think that the northeast is filled with various jewels.

original: aom ham aa dhi me ra be na:gu ru bhadt'a ra k'a ya ai dam mandal ma ni /
analyzed: aom ham aa dhi me ra be na:gu ru bhadt'a ra k'a ya ai dam mandal ma ni /
translated: Om ham adhi me rabena, guru bhad tara kaya idam mandala mani.

original: zhes brjod pas dbus su bskar nas bzhag nas steng gi ri rab kyi khar padma'i gdan la bla ma sbyan drangs te mchod pa gzhan dang bcas pas dbul /
analyzed: zhes brjod pas dbus su bskar nas bzhag nas steng gi ri rab kyi khar padma'i gdan la bla ma sbyan drangs te mchod pa gzhan dang bcas pas dbul /
translated: Having recited this, place it in the center. Invite the guru to the lotus seat on the top of Mount Meru and offer the other offerings.

original: mjug gang 'dod smon lam gdab pa dang / mandal bsdus pa'i me tog gtsang sar bskyal lo //
analyzed: mjug gang 'dod smon lam gdab pa dang / mandal bsdus pa'i me tog gtsang sar bskyal lo //
translated: At the end, make whatever aspirational prayers you like and take the flowers of the mandala to a clean place.

original: dus kyi 'khor lo nas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dus kyi 'khor lo nas bstan pa'o //
translated: This is taught in the Kālacakra.

original: bla ma la dbul ba mu stegs dang thun mong ngo /
analyzed: bla ma la dbul ba mu stegs dang thun mong ngo /
translated: Offering to the guru is shared with the tīrthikas.

original: mjug yon tan dran par bya ba ni dkyil 'khor chen po'i mdo nas /
analyzed: mjug yon tan dran par bya ba ni dkyil 'khor chen po'i mdo nas /
translated: The conclusion is to recall the qualities, as stated in the Sūtra of the Great Wheel:

original: lci ba chu bcas sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: lci ba chu bcas sbyin pa ste /
translated: The offering of water and cow dung

original: snyoms par byugs pa tshul khrims so //
analyzed: snyoms par byugs pa tshul khrims so //
translated: is the generosity of being even-minded.

original: srog chags bsal ba bzod ba yin //
analyzed: srog chags bsal ba bzod ba yin //
translated: Removing living beings is patience.🔽The six—the mandala itself, striving,🔽one-pointed mind, concentration,🔽and discerning the directions and times—

original: mandal nyid la brtson pa dang // rtse gcig sems pa bsam gtan dang // phyogs mtshams 'byed pa shes rab drug / sangs rgyas sogs la 'di dbul bas //
analyzed: mandal nyid la brtson pa dang // rtse gcig sems pa bsam gtan dang // phyogs mtshams 'byed pa shes rab drug / sangs rgyas sogs la 'di dbul bas //
translated: are offered to the buddhas and so on.

original: pha rol phyin drug thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: pha rol phyin drug thob par 'gyur //
translated: One will attain the six perfections.

original: nad kun las grol gser mdog 'gyur //
analyzed: nad kun las grol gser mdog 'gyur //
translated: One will be free from all illness and have a golden complexion.

original: lha dang mis mchod zla ba bzhin 'bar mdangs //
analyzed: lha dang mis mchod zla ba bzhin 'bar mdangs //
translated: One will be radiant like the moon and be worshiped by gods and humans.

original: nor dang gser dang dbang phyug rgyal por skye //
analyzed: nor dang gser dang dbang phyug rgyal por skye //
translated: One will be born wealthy, with gold, power, and as a king.

original: sangs rgyas gyur nas yongs su zhing khams dag / ces brjod pa'i yon tan dran par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gyur nas yongs su zhing khams dag / ces brjod pa'i yon tan dran par bya'o //
translated: After becoming a buddha, one’s realm will be completely pure.

original: nyin gung gi thun gyi chos spyod la lnga ste /
