original: bzod pa sdug bsngal dang du len pa dang / sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa sdug bsngal dang du len pa dang / sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'o //
translated: Patience is twofold: accepting suffering and disregarding harm.

original: lam pha rol tu phyin pa drug smon nas spyod pa'o //
analyzed: lam pha rol tu phyin pa drug smon nas spyod pa'o //
translated: The path is the six perfections practiced with aspiration.

original: 'bras bu skye ba la dbang ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / thabs dang / sems can gyi don byed pa la dbang ba lnga'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba la dbang ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / thabs dang / sems can gyi don byed pa la dbang ba lnga'o //
translated: The result is five masteries: over birth, afflictions, karma, means, and benefiting sentient beings.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i las dang po'i bslab bya la yang gsum ste /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i las dang po'i bslab bya la yang gsum ste /
translated: The training of the extremely pure beginner also has three parts:

original: gzhi sbyor ba sngon du song bas skyabs pa dang / dbang po dang / bsam pa 'jug pa'i sems kyis gong bzhin 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi sbyor ba sngon du song bas skyabs pa dang / dbang po dang / bsam pa 'jug pa'i sems kyis gong bzhin 'dod pa'o //
translated: taking refuge with the basis of preparation, and the aspiration to enter the mind of awakening with the intention and faculties as before.

original: bsam pa gzhan la sems pa kho na ste /
analyzed: bsam pa gzhan la sems pa kho na ste /
translated: The intention is to think of others.

original: snying rje dang bzod pa la gnyis te /
analyzed: snying rje dang bzod pa la gnyis te /
translated: Compassion and patience are twofold:

original: snying rje la yang gang zag la dmigs pa dang / chos la dmigs pa dang dmigs pa med pa gsum ste /
analyzed: snying rje la yang gang zag la dmigs pa dang / chos la dmigs pa dang dmigs pa med pa gsum ste /
translated: Compassion is also threefold: focused on the individual, focused on phenomena, and without reference.

original: gang zag la dmigs pa ni mu stegs dang / nyan thos dang thun mong ste /
analyzed: gang zag la dmigs pa ni mu stegs dang / nyan thos dang thun mong ste /
translated: The first is shared with the tīrthikas and śrāvakas.

original: sems can rkyen gyis sdug bsngal ba la skye ba'o //
analyzed: sems can rkyen gyis sdug bsngal ba la skye ba'o //
translated: It arises in relation to sentient beings who suffer due to conditions.

original: chos la dmigs pa ni sems tsam ste /
analyzed: chos la dmigs pa ni sems tsam ste /
translated: The second is the Mind Only school.

original: chos nyid ma rtogs pas lon te rtogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid ma rtogs pas lon te rtogs par byed pa'o //
translated: Since they have not realized reality, they are to be brought to realization.

original: dmigs pa med pa dbu ma ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa dbu ma ste /
translated: The third is the Middle Way.

original: sdug bsngal ba chos nyid ma rtogs pa la snying rje bskyed pa'i dus na rab tu mi gnas par shes pas gsum bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba chos nyid ma rtogs pa la snying rje bskyed pa'i dus na rab tu mi gnas par shes pas gsum bsdus pa'o //
translated: When compassion is generated for those who have not realized the reality of suffering, it is subsumed in the three: the realization that it is not really existent, the realization that it is not non-existent, and the realization that it is not both existent and non-existent.

original: bzod pa gzhan don du sdug bsngal phra mo la son zhing dang du len pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa gzhan don du sdug bsngal phra mo la son zhing dang du len pa'o //
translated: Patience is the willingness to endure even the slightest suffering for the sake of others.

original: goms nas che bas mi gnod la ji mi snyam pa dang / bzod pa de dang mi bzod pa rab tu mi gnas par brjod pa gsum ka bsgom ba'o //
analyzed: goms nas che bas mi gnod la ji mi snyam pa dang / bzod pa de dang mi bzod pa rab tu mi gnas par brjod pa gsum ka bsgom ba'o //
translated: Having become accustomed to that, one is not harmed by greater suffering, and one remains indifferent.

original: @137a * // lam pha rol tu phyin pa drug gzhan don du rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: @137a * // lam pha rol tu phyin pa drug gzhan don du rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The path is the completion of the six perfections for the sake of others.

original: 'bras bu re ba med pa dang / sku bzhi ngag gis 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu re ba med pa dang / sku bzhi ngag gis 'byung ba'o //
translated: The result is the four buddha bodies, which arise from the voice.

original: dus la 'dod pa chung ba'i mtha' med pa dang / chen po'i rgyu bskyed pa'i dus blangs ma thog dang / lam sgrub pa snying po byang chub thob pa dang / sangs rgyas pa'i dus bskal pa grangs med gsum pa'o //
analyzed: dus la 'dod pa chung ba'i mtha' med pa dang / chen po'i rgyu bskyed pa'i dus blangs ma thog dang / lam sgrub pa snying po byang chub thob pa dang / sangs rgyas pa'i dus bskal pa grangs med gsum pa'o //
translated: The time is the three incalculable aeons.

original: rigs la gnyis te /
analyzed: rigs la gnyis te /
translated: The family is of two kinds.

original: zla pa yar ngo la sems bskyed thob pa rnams byams pa la sogs pa ltar bram ze las sangs rgyas pa dang / mar ngo las thob pa rnams sh'akya thub pa la sogs ba ltar rgyal rigs las sangs rgyas pa'o//
analyzed: zla pa yar ngo la sems bskyed thob pa rnams byams pa la sogs pa ltar bram ze las sangs rgyas pa dang / mar ngo las thob pa rnams sh'akya thub pa la sogs ba ltar rgyal rigs las sangs rgyas pa'o//
translated: Those who have attained the generation of the Thought in the bright half of the month become Buddhas from the Brahman caste, like Maitreya and so on. Those who have attained it in the dark half of the month become Buddhas from the Kshatriya caste, like Shakyamuni and so on.

original: gsum dang ldan par shes par bya ba la gnyis te /
analyzed: gsum dang ldan par shes par bya ba la gnyis te /
translated: The three things to be known are the three things to be known.

original: ldan lugs bstan pa dang / nges pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: ldan lugs bstan pa dang / nges pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the way of endowment and the generation of certainty.

original: ldan lugs la nam mkha'i snying po'i mdo nas /
analyzed: ldan lugs la nam mkha'i snying po'i mdo nas /
translated: The way of endowment is taught in the Akashagarbha-sutra.

original: chos dang gang zag gcig nyid sems //
analyzed: chos dang gang zag gcig nyid sems //
translated: The Dharma and the person are one and the same mind.

original: smon dang 'jug dang so sor thar //
analyzed: smon dang 'jug dang so sor thar //
translated: Vows of aspiration and engagement, and the pratimoksha,

original: rig pa sbyor bas gzhan gyi don //
analyzed: rig pa sbyor bas gzhan gyi don //
translated: The knowledge of application for the benefit of others,

original: nus na gong nas gong du 'gyur //
analyzed: nus na gong nas gong du 'gyur //
translated: If one is able, it becomes higher and higher.

original: zhes gsungs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa bzhin te /
translated: As it is said,

original: gong gi so sor thar ba'i bslab pa rigs bdun gyi bye brag de rang gi sems yin pas 'og ma'i nyan thos ma spangs par theg pa chen po byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa yang yin la /
analyzed: gong gi so sor thar ba'i bslab pa rigs bdun gyi bye brag de rang gi sems yin pas 'og ma'i nyan thos ma spangs par theg pa chen po byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa yang yin la /
translated: The seven types of pratimoksha training mentioned above are one’s own mind, so without abandoning the lower [vows], they are also the bodhisattva vows of the Mahayana.

original: de yang sems kyi snang ba phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rgyud ltar lhar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de yang sems kyi snang ba phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rgyud ltar lhar gnas pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the appearances of the mind, the aggregates, elements, and sense sources, abide as the deity in the continuum.

original: de yang sngags kyi dam tshig ni /
analyzed: de yang sngags kyi dam tshig ni /
translated: Moreover, the tantric pledges are:

original: bdag dang dgos pa lhar gnas pa mthong bas lha dang / lha mi gnod pas nyan thos ltar nyes pa spong ba dang / lha ma yin gzhan gyis ma rtogs pas byang chub sems dpa' ltar phan 'dogs pa dang / de ltar sems su 'dus pa'i don la sems can rnams shin tu 'khrul nas sems rab tu mi gnas par ma shes shing bdag tu bzung ba la dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje skyes /
analyzed: bdag dang dgos pa lhar gnas pa mthong bas lha dang / lha mi gnod pas nyan thos ltar nyes pa spong ba dang / lha ma yin gzhan gyis ma rtogs pas byang chub sems dpa' ltar phan 'dogs pa dang / de ltar sems su 'dus pa'i don la sems can rnams shin tu 'khrul nas sems rab tu mi gnas par ma shes shing bdag tu bzung ba la dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje skyes /
translated: Since one sees oneself and the purpose as abiding as the deity, one is a deity; since one is not harmed by deities or humans, one abandons faults like śrāvakas; since one is not realized by other asuras, one benefits others like bodhisattvas.🔽Since sentient beings are extremely confused about the meaning of mind, they do not know that the mind is completely still. Compassion arises without a reference point for apprehending a self.

original: so sor thar pa'i bslab pa dang / dam tshig spyod pa dag la dmigs ba med pas smon 'jug gzhan don du byed pa dang / de yang sngags kyis lhar snang ba thams cad sems kyi 'phrul par snang bas nyan thos bye brag tu spyod la /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i bslab pa dang / dam tshig spyod pa dag la dmigs ba med pas smon 'jug gzhan don du byed pa dang / de yang sngags kyis lhar snang ba thams cad sems kyi 'phrul par snang bas nyan thos bye brag tu spyod la /
translated: Since one is free from the training of the pratimokṣa and the conduct of samaya, one engages in the aspiration and application for the benefit of others.

original: bye brag ma 'gags na nus pa so sor 'byung bas byang chub sems dpa' ltar 'dogs pa dang / de ltar sems kyi rgyun la brten nas sku bzhi 'byung bas /
analyzed: bye brag ma 'gags na nus pa so sor 'byung bas byang chub sems dpa' ltar 'dogs pa dang / de ltar sems kyi rgyun la brten nas sku bzhi 'byung bas /
translated: In that way, the four bodies arise in dependence on the continuum of mind, like the appearance of the guide of beings.

original: 'gro ba 'dren pa'i snang ba @137b ltar so sor thar pa'i bslab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa dang / sngags kyi dam tshig dang gsum ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dren pa'i snang ba @137b ltar so sor thar pa'i bslab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa dang / sngags kyi dam tshig dang gsum ldan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, one should possess the three: the training in the pratimoksha, the vows of a bodhisattva, and the commitments of mantra.

original: sku bzhi nus pa so so nas snang zhing chos skur 'dus shing 'byung ba bzhin sdom pa yar ldan du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sku bzhi nus pa so so nas snang zhing chos skur 'dus shing 'byung ba bzhin sdom pa yar ldan du 'gyur te /
translated: The four bodies appear individually from the potential, and just as they arise from the dharmakaya, the vows are also transformed in an ascending order.

original: so sor thar ba byang chub sems dpar 'gyur //
analyzed: so sor thar ba byang chub sems dpar 'gyur //
translated: The pratimoksha becomes the bodhisattva vow.

original: de sngags su 'gyur /
analyzed: de sngags su 'gyur /
translated: That becomes the mantra vow.

original: de so sor snang ba yang btub pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de so sor snang ba yang btub pa bzhin no //
translated: That appears individually, just as it is possible.

original: nges pa bskyed pa yang bzhi ste /
analyzed: nges pa bskyed pa yang bzhi ste /
translated: There are four ways to generate certainty:

original: gzhi ma nyams pa dang / rgyu ma nyams pa dang / lam ma nyams pa dang / 'bras bu ma nyams pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi ma nyams pa dang / rgyu ma nyams pa dang / lam ma nyams pa dang / 'bras bu ma nyams pa'o //
translated: the basis is undamaged, the cause is undamaged, the path is undamaged, and the result is undamaged.

original: gzhi ma nyams pa slob dpon la la dag rten dang brten par sdom pa gsum min par 'dod /
analyzed: gzhi ma nyams pa slob dpon la la dag rten dang brten par sdom pa gsum min par 'dod /
translated: Some masters claim that the basis is not impaired, because the three vows are not the supported and the support.

original: de mi bden te /
analyzed: de mi bden te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: ka bas gdung dang 'og gis steng khang bteg pa ltar ma yin zer ba mi rigs te /
analyzed: ka bas gdung dang 'og gis steng khang bteg pa ltar ma yin zer ba mi rigs te /
translated: It is not correct to say that the vows are not like a pillar supporting a beam or the lower story supporting the upper story of a building.

original: sdom pa yar ldan du gnas gyur pas sa bon gyi dus na sa bon ma nyams /
analyzed: sdom pa yar ldan du gnas gyur pas sa bon gyi dus na sa bon ma nyams /
translated: The vows are transformed in such a way that the higher vows contain the lower ones. Therefore, at the time of the seed, the seed is not impaired;

original: myu gu ma spangs /
analyzed: myu gu ma spangs /
translated: the sprout is not abandoned.

original: 'bras bu'i dus na 'bras bu ma nyams la sa bon ma spangs te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dus na 'bras bu ma nyams la sa bon ma spangs te /
translated: At the time of the fruit, the fruit is not impaired; the seed is not abandoned.

original: dam tshig gi dus na so sor thar par ma song ste /
analyzed: dam tshig gi dus na so sor thar par ma song ste /
translated: At the time of the commitments, the pratimoksha vows are not transcended.

original: mi gnas med kyang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: mi gnas med kyang nyes pa med do //
translated: Although they do not exist separately, there is no fault.

original: nyams pa spang /
analyzed: nyams pa spang /
translated: The impaired is abandoned.

original: slob dpon la mi gcig gis mi mang po gsod na /
analyzed: slob dpon la mi gcig gis mi mang po gsod na /
translated: If a single person kills many people,

original: mi gcig po de ma bsad na byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa nyams la /
analyzed: mi gcig po de ma bsad na byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa nyams la /
translated: if that single person is not killed, the bodhisattva vow is impaired.

original: bsad na so sor thar ba'i sdom pa nyams par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: bsad na so sor thar ba'i sdom pa nyams par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: If he is killed, the pratimoksha vow is impaired.

original: ma shin brdzun nam thabs kyi yan lag nyams zer te de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: ma shin brdzun nam thabs kyi yan lag nyams zer te de yang mi bden te /
translated: It is said that if one lies or uses skillful means, the commitments are impaired. That is also incorrect.

original: so sor thar ba'i ltung ba ni sbyor ba dang / dngos dang / mjug rdzogs pas 'ong ste /
analyzed: so sor thar ba'i ltung ba ni sbyor ba dang / dngos dang / mjug rdzogs pas 'ong ste /
translated: The downfall of the pratimoksha occurs through the completion of the preparation, the actual act, and the conclusion.🔽The bodhisattva downfall occurs without preparation or conclusion, but with the actual act.

original: sbyor ba dang / mjug med pa dang / dngos so sor thar ba bdag 'khor ba la 'jigs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don byed du dmyal ba la mi 'jigs par nyes pa len pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang / mjug med pa dang / dngos so sor thar ba bdag 'khor ba la 'jigs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don byed du dmyal ba la mi 'jigs par nyes pa len pa'o //
translated: The pratimoksha practitioner fears samsara and does not take on the sufferings of others, while the bodhisattva, in order to benefit beings, has no fear of the hells and takes on the sufferings of others.

original: de ltar srog mang bar bton pa dang / gcig la sdig pa gos par dang / bdag dmyal ba la mi 'jigs par rang yang thar pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar srog mang bar bton pa dang / gcig la sdig pa gos par dang / bdag dmyal ba la mi 'jigs par rang yang thar pa'o //
translated: Thus, the pratimoksha practitioner saves many lives, but only one person can be protected from the effects of a particular negative action, and only the practitioner himself can be freed from the hells.

original: de bzhin du brdzun sogs yan lag dang bcas pa nyams pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du brdzun sogs yan lag dang bcas pa nyams pas so //
translated: Similarly, the pratimoksha vows are broken by lying and the other transgressions with a similar effect.🔽Some teachers say that the path of the bodhisattva is not impaired,

original: lam ma nyams pa yang slob dpon la la dag / so sor thar pa'i bslab pa rten du dgos na /
analyzed: lam ma nyams pa yang slob dpon la la dag / so sor thar pa'i bslab pa rten du dgos na /
translated: because the training of the pratimoksha is necessary as a basis for the bodhisattva vows,

original: so sor thar ba'i bslab pa gong gi rten khyad par du 'phags pa drug la skye'i /
analyzed: so sor thar ba'i bslab pa gong gi rten khyad par du 'phags pa drug la skye'i /
translated: and the training of the pratimoksha can only arise in the six special states.

original: byang chub kyi sems 'gro ba gzhan dang gling gzhan nas skye zer te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems 'gro ba gzhan dang gling gzhan nas skye zer te /
translated: They say that the bodhichitta can only arise in other states of existence and in other continents.

original: de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: de yang mi bden te /
translated: This is not true.

original: @138a * // de ltar mu stegs ltar rkyen med pas rgyu gtso bos las brdzun te /
analyzed: @138a * // de ltar mu stegs ltar rkyen med pas rgyu gtso bos las brdzun te /
translated: In this way, the cause is not false, as it is in the case of the tīrthikas, because of the absence of conditions.🔽The principal cause generates the individual six kinds of migrators.

original: 'gro drug so so bskyed la dge bas thar pa thob pa'i rgyu yin pa la /
analyzed: 'gro drug so so bskyed la dge bas thar pa thob pa'i rgyu yin pa la /
translated: Virtuous actions are the cause for attaining liberation.

original: dge bas ngan 'gror 'gro ba yang yod dgos pa la med pa des de ltar yin te /
analyzed: dge bas ngan 'gror 'gro ba yang yod dgos pa la med pa des de ltar yin te /
translated: However, it is not necessary that those who engage in virtuous actions go to the lower realms.

original: sangs rgyas kyi thugs rjes sems can mir skyes la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi thugs rjes sems can mir skyes la /
translated: Through the compassion of the Buddha, sentient beings are born as humans.

original: mi bsnyen gnas bsrungs pas nyan thos kyi rten bzang pa de goms pa las byang chub kya sems su 'gyur bas thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: mi bsnyen gnas bsrungs pas nyan thos kyi rten bzang pa de goms pa las byang chub kya sems su 'gyur bas thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
translated: By observing the one-day vows, the support of the śrāvakas is excellent.

original: rgyu rkyen ma song bar thams cad mkhyen pa 'byung na /
analyzed: rgyu rkyen ma song bar thams cad mkhyen pa 'byung na /
translated: If omniscience arose without the progression of causes and conditions,

original: mu stegs dang nyan thos la thams cad mkhyen pa'i rigs na /
analyzed: mu stegs dang nyan thos la thams cad mkhyen pa'i rigs na /
translated: then the tīrthikas and śrāvakas would have the lineage of omniscience.

original: chos nyid stong pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rtogs bas 'thob zer na /
analyzed: chos nyid stong pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rtogs bas 'thob zer na /
translated: If it is said that omniscience is attained by realizing the perfection of wisdom, the emptiness of dharmatā,

original: chos nyid yod pas 'thob na sems can la cis med /
analyzed: chos nyid yod pas 'thob na sems can la cis med /
translated: if omniscience is attained because dharmatā exists, why is it not present in sentient beings?

original: rtogs pas chog na rtogs tshad gang kho na /
analyzed: rtogs pas chog na rtogs tshad gang kho na /
translated: If it is sufficient to realize it, what exactly is realized?

original: rtogs tshad gang kho na tsam gyis chog na da lta ga re /
analyzed: rtogs tshad gang kho na tsam gyis chog na da lta ga re /
translated: If it is sufficient to have only a certain amount of realization, then what is the point of the present [discussion]?

original: tshad bstan du yod na thams cad mkhyen te /
analyzed: tshad bstan du yod na thams cad mkhyen te /
translated: If there is a taught standard, then [the Buddha] is omniscient.

original: brtags dpyad rigs pa gzhi ci bya /
analyzed: brtags dpyad rigs pa gzhi ci bya /
translated: Why would one need to analyze and investigate the basis?

original: med na rtsod pa brjod pa la don med /
analyzed: med na rtsod pa brjod pa la don med /
translated: If there is none, then it is pointless to speak of debate.

original: thob pas mkhyen na thob rgyu brtag ste /
analyzed: thob pas mkhyen na thob rgyu brtag ste /
translated: If [the Buddha] knows through attainment, then the object of attainment should be investigated.

original: des na lam sngon du ma song bar 'gro ba gzhan dang / mi gzhan dag la byang chub sems mi skye'o //
analyzed: des na lam sngon du ma song bar 'gro ba gzhan dang / mi gzhan dag la byang chub sems mi skye'o //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva mind will not arise in other beings who have not previously traversed the path, nor in other people.

original: 'bras bu ma nyams par bya ba la slob dpon la la nyan thos kyi rigs dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / theg pa chen po dang / rigs nges pa dang / ma nges pa dang / chad pa drug yod la /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma nyams par bya ba la slob dpon la la nyan thos kyi rigs dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / theg pa chen po dang / rigs nges pa dang / ma nges pa dang / chad pa drug yod la /
translated: In order to preserve the result, some masters say that there are six types of śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and followers of the Mahāyāna, those of definite and indefinite potential, and those who are excluded.

original: sangs rgyas kyang rim gyis dang / nyan thos las ldog pa dang / rang sangs rgyas las ldog pa dang / so sor yod pa mtshan nyid kyis sangs rgyas pa dang / sngags kyis dang / sangs rgyas so sor yod pa la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyang rim gyis dang / nyan thos las ldog pa dang / rang sangs rgyas las ldog pa dang / so sor yod pa mtshan nyid kyis sangs rgyas pa dang / sngags kyis dang / sangs rgyas so sor yod pa la //
translated: And there are also six types of buddhas: those who attain buddhahood gradually, those who turn away from the śrāvakas, those who turn away from the pratyekabuddhas, those who attain buddhahood through characteristics, those who attain buddhahood through mantra, and those who attain buddhahood individually.

original: bstan pa yun ring thung dang / chos theg pa che chung ston la /
analyzed: bstan pa yun ring thung dang / chos theg pa che chung ston la /
translated: The duration of the teachings, the greater and lesser vehicles of the teachings.🔽

original: bram ze dang rgyal rigs so sor 'dod te /
analyzed: bram ze dang rgyal rigs so sor 'dod te /
translated: The duration of the teachings, and the teachings of the greater and lesser vehicles of Dharma, are taught to be different for the brahmins and the royalty.

original: de mi bden te /
analyzed: de mi bden te /
translated: That is not true.

original: gzhi don dam pa la yang sems can dang / sangs rgyas gnyis la khyad med par /
analyzed: gzhi don dam pa la yang sems can dang / sangs rgyas gnyis la khyad med par /
translated: In the ultimate ground, there is no difference between buddhas and sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas la khyad yod de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la khyad yod de /
translated: There is a difference in the buddhas.

original: rgyu rig pa bzang rtog tu sbyor ba la yang 'dra snyam /
analyzed: rgyu rig pa bzang rtog tu sbyor ba la yang 'dra snyam /
translated: It is also similar in the application of the excellent view of the cause.

original: lam sems gnyis dang phar phyin drug spyod pa yang 'dra snyam /
analyzed: lam sems gnyis dang phar phyin drug spyod pa yang 'dra snyam /
translated: It is also similar in the conduct of the two minds and the six pāramitās of the path.

original: 'bras bu 'dod pa che chung bstan pa dang / chos rigs kyang gdul bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dod pa che chung bstan pa dang / chos rigs kyang gdul bya ste /
translated: The teachings of the greater and lesser desires of the result and the dharmas of the family are for the disciples.

original: sku bzhi la bzang ngan med /
analyzed: sku bzhi la bzang ngan med /
translated: There is no good or bad in the four kāyas.

original: gal te yod na gong bzhin du dge bas ngan song dang / sdig pa dang thar pa dang / nyan thos kyis bcu @138b bzhi pa'i sa dang / sngags dang nyan thos la sogs par 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: gal te yod na gong bzhin du dge bas ngan song dang / sdig pa dang thar pa dang / nyan thos kyis bcu @138b bzhi pa'i sa dang / sngags dang nyan thos la sogs par 'gro ba'o //
translated: If there were, as explained above, the virtuous would go to the lower realms, and the wicked would attain liberation, śrāvakas would attain the fourteenth stage, and mantras, śrāvakas, and so on would go to the higher realms.

original: de nas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs bde ba chen por gnas shing chos skur snang ba la /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs bde ba chen por gnas shing chos skur snang ba la /
translated: Then, all buddhas abide in the great bliss of the mind and appear in the dharmakāya.

original: gsung brjod du med par gnas te /
analyzed: gsung brjod du med par gnas te /
translated: His speech abides as inexpressible,

original: theg pa gsum dang theg pa'i dgos par yang gsung ngo //
analyzed: theg pa gsum dang theg pa'i dgos par yang gsung ngo //
translated: and he speaks of the three vehicles and the purpose of the vehicles.

original: sku bcu bzhi'i sa la bzhugs la rdo rje 'chang gi ngo bo gzugs skur ston to //
analyzed: sku bcu bzhi'i sa la bzhugs la rdo rje 'chang gi ngo bo gzugs skur ston to //
translated: He abides on the fourteenth stage of awakening and displays the rupakaya, the essence of Vajradhara.

original: yon tan spros pa dang bral la bzang ngan gyi rtog pa 'dod yon du snang 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan spros pa dang bral la bzang ngan gyi rtog pa 'dod yon du snang 'grub pa'o //
translated: His qualities are free from conceptual elaborations, and good and bad thoughts appear as objects of desire.

original: phrin las bya brtsal dang bral ba dgyes rdor ltar sems can thams cad rigs lnga dang / gsum dang gcig tu grub pa'o //
analyzed: phrin las bya brtsal dang bral ba dgyes rdor ltar sems can thams cad rigs lnga dang / gsum dang gcig tu grub pa'o //
translated: His activity is free from effort, and all sentient beings are established as the five families, three families, and one family, as in the Hevajra tantra.

original: de ltar shes pas sdom pa gsum rdzogs nas gsum ldan du bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar shes pas sdom pa gsum rdzogs nas gsum ldan du bya'o //
translated: By knowing this, the three vows are perfected and become unified.

original: sngags kyi rgyas par 'og gi skabs su bstan pa nas dbang thob par shes par gyis shig / shes pas spangs pa la gnyis te /
analyzed: sngags kyi rgyas par 'og gi skabs su bstan pa nas dbang thob par shes par gyis shig / shes pas spangs pa la gnyis te /
translated: The extensive explanation of the mantra [vows] will be taught in the section below, so understand that the empowerment is obtained.🔽Knowing What to Abandon🔽There are two parts to knowing what to abandon:

original: nyes pa shes pa dang srang ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa shes pa dang srang ba'o //
translated: knowing the faults and abandoning them.🔽Knowing the Faults🔽There are two parts to knowing the faults:

original: nyes pa shes pa la smon 'jug gnyis te /
analyzed: nyes pa shes pa la smon 'jug gnyis te /
translated: aspiration and engagement.

original: smon pa'i rtsa ba'i nyes pa gzhan don la smon pa bzhag nas nyan thos su 'gyur ba'o //🔽yan lag la bzhi ste /
analyzed: smon pa'i rtsa ba'i nyes pa gzhan don la smon pa bzhag nas nyan thos su 'gyur ba'o // yan lag la bzhi ste /
translated: The other root downfall of the aspiration is to give up the aspiration and become a śrāvaka.

original: dkon mchog / mkhan po /
analyzed: dkon mchog / mkhan po /
translated: There are four downfalls related to the branches:🔽to deceive the Three Jewels,🔽to deceive one’s abbot,

original: slob dpon / rnal 'byor pa /
analyzed: slob dpon / rnal 'byor pa /
translated: one’s preceptor,🔽a spiritual friend,🔽a scholar,

original: pandi ta / dge 'dun chos skyong ba'i rgyal po /
analyzed: pandi ta / dge 'dun chos skyong ba'i rgyal po /
translated: a king who protects the Buddhist doctrine,🔽one’s parents,

original: pha ma / mchod par 'os pa bslus pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems bskyed pa mthong ba thos pa /
analyzed: pha ma / mchod par 'os pa bslus pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems bskyed pa mthong ba thos pa /
translated: or anyone worthy of respect;🔽to be jealous of the bodhicitta aroused by others,

original: slong dpon gcig pa dus gcig tu bskyed pa la phrag dog gis bskyed pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bye brag song nas gong du 'pho bar mi 'gyur bar de rnams kyi dge ba'i rgyu 'bras la skur nas 'gyod pa bskyed ba dang /
analyzed: slong dpon gcig pa dus gcig tu bskyed pa la phrag dog gis bskyed pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bye brag song nas gong du 'pho bar mi 'gyur bar de rnams kyi dge ba'i rgyu 'bras la skur nas 'gyod pa bskyed ba dang /
translated: to disparage the causes and effects of virtue of śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas, and to cause them to regret their virtuous actions,

original: sems can thams cad la bdag gi lus ngag gis gnod pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la bdag gi lus ngag gis gnod pa byed pa'o //
translated: and to harm others physically or verbally.

original: 'jug ba'i nyes pa la gnyis te /
analyzed: 'jug ba'i nyes pa la gnyis te /
translated: There are two downfalls related to involvement:

original: rtsa ba pha rol phyin pa drug gzhan don bor nas rang don du bsngo ba dang / yan lag la yang bzhi ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba pha rol phyin pa drug gzhan don bor nas rang don du bsngo ba dang / yan lag la yang bzhi ste /
translated: There are four branches:

original: zhe sdang gi bshags pas mi phan par gzhan 'tshog pa dang / chags pas ser sna dang ldan te /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi bshags pas mi phan par gzhan 'tshog pa dang / chags pas ser sna dang ldan te /
translated: (1) confessing one's sins out of hostility, not out of a desire to benefit others;🔽(2) being miserly out of attachment, not giving the Dharma or wealth to those who need them;🔽(3) harming others out of rivalry, not understanding that phenomena are devoid of self;

original: chos nor dgos pa dang / 'dod pa la mi ster ba dang / chos rnams bdag med par ma shes pa gzhan la 'gran sems kyis gnod pa dang / sangs rgyas gzhan don las mi 'dod par rgyu 'bras bkag nas smon 'jug spong ba'o //
analyzed: chos nor dgos pa dang / 'dod pa la mi ster ba dang / chos rnams bdag med par ma shes pa gzhan la 'gran sems kyis gnod pa dang / sangs rgyas gzhan don las mi 'dod par rgyu 'bras bkag nas smon 'jug spong ba'o //
translated: (4) not aspiring to buddhahood for the benefit of others, but rejecting the engaged and aspirational forms of the awakening mind by denying cause and effect.

original: spang bla yang gnyis te /
analyzed: spang bla yang gnyis te /
translated: There are two ways to relinquish these faults:

original: smon pa nyams par shes /🔽smon pa nyes pa spang /
analyzed: smon pa nyams par shes / smon pa nyes pa spang /
translated: (1) to recognize the faults of the aspirational awakening mind;🔽(2) to eliminate the faults of the aspirational awakening mind.🔽There are two ways to eliminate the faults of the engaged awakening mind:🔽(1) to recognize the faults of the engaged awakening mind;

original: @139a * // 'jug pa'i nyes pa 'jug pas spang pa'o //
analyzed: @139a * // 'jug pa'i nyes pa 'jug pas spang pa'o //
translated: (2) to eliminate the faults of the engaged awakening mind.

original: shes pas bsgrub pa la gnyis te /
analyzed: shes pas bsgrub pa la gnyis te /
translated: There are two ways to accomplish the awakening mind through knowledge:🔽(1) to recognize the qualities of the awakening mind;

original: yon tan du shes pa dang / yon tan du shes pa bsgrub bo /
analyzed: yon tan du shes pa dang / yon tan du shes pa bsgrub bo /
translated: (2) to accomplish the recognition of the qualities of the awakening mind.

original: yon tan la gsum ste /
analyzed: yon tan la gsum ste /
translated: There are three qualities:

original: sangs rgyas la skyabs pas sangs rgyas kyi zhal mthong ba dang / chos la skyabs pas sangs rgyas kyi chos nyan cing zhal mthong ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun la skyabs pas grogs byang chub sems dpa' dang 'grogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la skyabs pas sangs rgyas kyi zhal mthong ba dang / chos la skyabs pas sangs rgyas kyi chos nyan cing zhal mthong ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun la skyabs pas grogs byang chub sems dpa' dang 'grogs pa'o //
translated: By taking refuge in the Buddha, one sees the face of the Buddha; by taking refuge in the Dharma, one hears the Dharma of the Buddha and sees his face; by taking refuge in the Sangha of Bodhisattvas, one associates with Bodhisattvas.

original: lam gyi yon tan mkhan po dang bla ma mchod pas da lta nyid sangs rgyas dang 'grogs pa dang / sems can slu ba dang 'gyod pa spangs nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad pas da lta nyid theg ma chen po'i chos nyan pa dang /
analyzed: lam gyi yon tan mkhan po dang bla ma mchod pas da lta nyid sangs rgyas dang 'grogs pa dang / sems can slu ba dang 'gyod pa spangs nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad pas da lta nyid theg ma chen po'i chos nyan pa dang /
translated: By the quality of the path, one associates with the Buddha in the present by worshipping the teacher and the master; by practicing the six perfections after having abandoned the deception and regret of sentient beings, one hears the Dharma of the Great Vehicle in the present;

original: gzhan la gnod sems spangs nas phan sems dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' dang da lta 'grogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la gnod sems spangs nas phan sems dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' dang da lta 'grogs pa'o //
translated: by abandoning malice toward others and by being endowed with the intention to help, one associates with the Bodhisattvas in the present.

original: 'bras bu'i yon tan 'jug pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pas gdul bya la sprul sku dang / tshogs rdzogs pa'i snang ba la longs sku ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i yon tan 'jug pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pas gdul bya la sprul sku dang / tshogs rdzogs pa'i snang ba la longs sku ste /
translated: By the quality of the result, one has the emanation body for the disciples by practicing the six perfections with engagement; one has the beatific body for the appearance of the perfection of the assemblies.

original: da lta nyid sangs rgyas yin pa dang / gang 'dod gang phan spyod pas da lta nyid chos ston pa dang / bstan pa dang spyod pas phan pas da lta nyid du byang chub sems dpas bskor ba'o //
analyzed: da lta nyid sangs rgyas yin pa dang / gang 'dod gang phan spyod pas da lta nyid chos ston pa dang / bstan pa dang spyod pas phan pas da lta nyid du byang chub sems dpas bskor ba'o //
translated: He is a Buddha right now, because he has attained the essence of enlightenment. He teaches the Dharma right now, because he acts in whatever way is desired and beneficial. He is surrounded by Bodhisattvas right now, because he benefits the teachings and beings.

original: bsgrub par bya ba la bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba la bzhi ste /
translated: The four things to be accomplished are:

original: sdom pa gsum bsgrub pa dang / mi nyams par bya ba dang // rgyas par bya ba dang / nyes pa bcos thabs so //
analyzed: sdom pa gsum bsgrub pa dang / mi nyams par bya ba dang // rgyas par bya ba dang / nyes pa bcos thabs so //
translated: accomplishing the three vows, not letting them deteriorate, making them grow, and the means of correcting transgressions.

original: sdom pa gsum sgrub pa ni sdom pa dngos dang / rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i sdig spang ba dang / sems can rnams kyi dge ba bsgrub pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug ste /
analyzed: sdom pa gsum sgrub pa ni sdom pa dngos dang / rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i sdig spang ba dang / sems can rnams kyi dge ba bsgrub pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug ste /
translated: Accomplishing the three vows means accomplishing the actual vows, abandoning negative actions together with their inherent tendencies, and accomplishing the virtue of sentient beings, which is the six perfections.

original: sbyin pa chos dang skyabs dang / zang zing gi sbyin pa bdag gtong ba po dang / gzhan len pa po dang / sbyin par bya ba'i rgyu gsum sgyu mar shes pa'i gzhan don sgrub pa dang / dge ba chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa chos dang skyabs dang / zang zing gi sbyin pa bdag gtong ba po dang / gzhan len pa po dang / sbyin par bya ba'i rgyu gsum sgyu mar shes pa'i gzhan don sgrub pa dang / dge ba chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang /
translated: Accomplishing the benefit of others is the practice of generosity, which is giving the Dharma, protection, and material things. The giver, the receiver, and the gift are understood to be illusory. Accomplishing virtue is the discipline of gathering virtue.

original: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can don byed kyi tshul khrims dang / sdug bsngal dang du len pa dang / sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa dang ; zas mos pa dang / go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / sbyor ba dang / des par spyod pa dang /🔽mi 'gong ba'i dang / dpa' bo'i brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan lus dal //🔽ngag dpen / sems zhi ba dang / thos bsam bsgom pa'i shes rab rnams sgyu mar shes pas gzhan don bsgrub @139b pa'o //🔽sems can don byed kyi tshul khrims gzhan don du sbyin sogs stobs gar che rim pa dang / dam bcas pa med pas sgyu ma'i rnam pas sgyu ma shes pas bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can don byed kyi tshul khrims dang / sdug bsngal dang du len pa dang / sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa dang ; zas mos pa dang / go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / sbyor ba dang / des par spyod pa dang / mi 'gong ba'i dang / dpa' bo'i brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan lus dal // ngag dpen / sems zhi ba dang / thos bsam bsgom pa'i shes rab rnams sgyu mar shes pas gzhan don bsgrub @139b pa'o // sems can don byed kyi tshul khrims gzhan don du sbyin sogs stobs gar che rim pa dang / dam bcas pa med pas sgyu ma'i rnam pas sgyu ma shes pas bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The morality of vow, the morality of working for the benefit of sentient beings, the acceptance of suffering, the indifference to suffering, the contentment with food, the armor-like effort, the effort of application, the effort of the hero, the meditative concentration of the body at ease,🔽the meditative concentration of the speech at ease, the meditative concentration of the mind at ease, and the wisdom of hearing, reflecting, and meditating.🔽The morality of working for the benefit of sentient beings is accomplished by the knowledge of illusion, since one practices generosity and so forth for the benefit of others to the best of one's ability, and since one is not attached to the result of one's actions.🔽🔽The acceptance of suffering is accomplished by the knowledge of illusion, since one is indifferent to the suffering that arises from working for the benefit of sentient beings.🔽

original: sems can sngon las kyi 'bras bu yin pas dpen par bsgrub pa dang / ma chags pas lus dang longs spyod dge ba sbyin pa dang / bdag med pas 'bras bu mi re ba dang / sangs rgyas gzhan las 'byung bas sgyo ba mi bya ba dang /
analyzed: sems can sngon las kyi 'bras bu yin pas dpen par bsgrub pa dang / ma chags pas lus dang longs spyod dge ba sbyin pa dang / bdag med pas 'bras bu mi re ba dang / sangs rgyas gzhan las 'byung bas sgyo ba mi bya ba dang /
translated: Since sentient beings are the result of previous karma, one should practice in solitude; since one is not attached, one should give one's body, possessions, and virtue; since one is selfless, one should not hope for a result; since the Buddha arises from another, one should not deceive;

original: slob dpon sangs rgyas dang 'dra bas bsnyen pa dang / grogs po byang chub sems dpa' bsnyen pa dang / dge ba byed pa thams cad la yi rangs pa dang bskul ba dang / lus ngag yid kyis don las gzhan mi bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon sangs rgyas dang 'dra bas bsnyen pa dang / grogs po byang chub sems dpa' bsnyen pa dang / dge ba byed pa thams cad la yi rangs pa dang bskul ba dang / lus ngag yid kyis don las gzhan mi bya'o //
translated: since the master is like the Buddha, one should serve him; since the friend is a bodhisattva, one should serve him; since one delights in all virtuous actions, one should encourage oneself and others; and since one should not do anything other than the meaning, one should not do anything other than the meaning with body, speech, and mind.

original: rgyas par bya ba la gnyis te /
analyzed: rgyas par bya ba la gnyis te /
translated: The extensive explanation has two parts:

original: ma rgyas pa dang / de rgyas par bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma rgyas pa dang / de rgyas par bya ba'o //
translated: the incomplete and making it complete.

original: ma rgyas pa la rgyu 'bras gnyis te /
analyzed: ma rgyas pa la rgyu 'bras gnyis te /
translated: The incomplete has two parts: cause and result.

original: rgyu las bsngo ba ma shes pa /🔽bsngo ba lus pa /🔽bsngo ba log pa /🔽bsngo ba ma dag pa /
analyzed: rgyu las bsngo ba ma shes pa / bsngo ba lus pa / bsngo ba log pa / bsngo ba ma dag pa /
translated: Not knowing how to dedicate the cause🔽is a deficiency in dedication.🔽Wrong dedication

original: bsngo ba ma brgyas pa'o //
analyzed: bsngo ba ma brgyas pa'o //
translated: is an impure dedication.🔽Incomplete dedication🔽is not knowing how to dedicate.

original: bsngo ba ma shes pa ni sngon du sems can la khas blangs nas /
analyzed: bsngo ba ma shes pa ni sngon du sems can la khas blangs nas /
translated: Having previously promised sentient beings,

original: chos nor skyabs mi ster ba'o //
analyzed: chos nor skyabs mi ster ba'o //
translated: It is not giving if you do not give your wealth and Dharma to those who seek them.

original: mi 'dod mi dgos mi phan na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: mi 'dod mi dgos mi phan na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if you do not give what is not desired, not needed, or not beneficial.

original: bsngo ba ma lus pa ni sbyin par bsams nas ma gyin ba'o //🔽de yang mi 'dod /🔽mi dgos / mi pan /
analyzed: bsngo ba ma lus pa ni sbyin par bsams nas ma gyin ba'o // de yang mi 'dod / mi dgos / mi pan /
translated: It is not giving if you give with a mind that is not completely turned toward giving.

original: phan chung / gnod na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: phan chung / gnod na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if you do not give what is not desired, not needed, or not beneficial.

original: bsngo ba log pa ni gcig la bsngos nas gzhan gcig la byin na'o //
analyzed: bsngo ba log pa ni gcig la bsngos nas gzhan gcig la byin na'o //
translated: It is not giving if you give what is to be given to one person to someone else.

original: gcig stobs che la gcig mi 'dod sogs gong ltar na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gcig stobs che la gcig mi 'dod sogs gong ltar na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if one is more powerful, or if the other does not desire it, and so forth, as before.

original: bsngo ba ma dag pa ni lan la re ba dang / drin brtsis pa dang / 'di'i phan la mi re ba'o //
analyzed: bsngo ba ma dag pa ni lan la re ba dang / drin brtsis pa dang / 'di'i phan la mi re ba'o //
translated: It is not pure giving if you give in order to receive something in return, or out of a sense of obligation, or in order to benefit from it in the future.

original: des chos 'phel zhing rang gi yid la tshe 'di'i 'dod pa med na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: des chos 'phel zhing rang gi yid la tshe 'di'i 'dod pa med na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if your giving increases the Dharma and you have no desire for the objects of this life.

original: bsngo ba ma rgyas pa ni grags pa dang / gzhan 'og tu gzhug pa ste /
analyzed: bsngo ba ma rgyas pa ni grags pa dang / gzhan 'og tu gzhug pa ste /
translated: It is not vast giving if you give in order to be famous or to put others down.

original: des bstan pa la phan zhing yid la med na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: des bstan pa la phan zhing yid la med na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if your giving benefits the teachings and you have no desire for the objects of this life.

original: 'bras bu la yang lnga ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu la yang lnga ste /
translated: There are five types of results of giving.

original: bsngo ba lus pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsngos pa'o //
analyzed: bsngo ba lus pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsngos pa'o //
translated: Incomplete dedication is not dedicating the roots of virtue even though one has practiced the six perfections.

original: bsngo ba ma shes pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu longs spyod che ba la sogs par re ba'o //
analyzed: bsngo ba ma shes pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu longs spyod che ba la sogs par re ba'o //
translated: Ignorant dedication is hoping for a result such as great wealth from the cause of generosity and so forth.

original: bsngo ba log pa ni bdag don du bsngos pa'o //
analyzed: bsngo ba log pa ni bdag don du bsngos pa'o //
translated: Wrong dedication is dedicating for one's own benefit.

original: bsngo ba ma dag pa ni sems can sangs rgyas su mi smon pa'o //
analyzed: bsngo ba ma dag pa ni sems can sangs rgyas su mi smon pa'o //
translated: Impure dedication is not aspiring for sentient beings to become buddhas.

original: bsngo ba ma rgyas pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyas ma thebs pa'o //🔽rgyas @140a * //
analyzed: bsngo ba ma rgyas pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyas ma thebs pa'o // rgyas @140a * //
translated: Incomplete dedication is not sealed with the perfection of wisdom.

original: par bya ba de rnams las bzlog pa ste /🔽shes pa / ma lus pa /🔽ma log pa /
analyzed: par bya ba de rnams las bzlog pa ste / shes pa / ma lus pa / ma log pa /
translated: The opposite of those is complete dedication.

original: dag pa / rgyas pa byang chub sems dpa' 'dod pa che bas sems can la bsngo ba ma lus pa la sogs pas spyin no ;
analyzed: dag pa / rgyas pa byang chub sems dpa' 'dod pa che bas sems can la bsngo ba ma lus pa la sogs pas spyin no ;
translated: The complete dedication is the bodhisattva's great aspiration to dedicate to sentient beings without exception.

original: rgyas pa la sogs pas bsngos pa sems can thams cad kyi don du bdag sku bzhi thob ste /
analyzed: rgyas pa la sogs pas bsngos pa sems can thams cad kyi don du bdag sku bzhi thob ste /
translated: The dedication sealed with vastness and so forth is for the sake of all sentient beings, and I will attain the four bodies of a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas nas sems can thams cad sku bzhi la dgod par smon la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nas sems can thams cad sku bzhi la dgod par smon la /
translated: Having become a Buddha, one vows to establish all sentient beings in the four bodies of Buddhahood.

original: gzhan yang mdo dang / slob dpon gzhan ltar smon no //🔽'dod pa chung ba de dag rnams sems can thams cad sangs ma rgyas kyi bar du /
analyzed: gzhan yang mdo dang / slob dpon gzhan ltar smon no // 'dod pa chung ba de dag rnams sems can thams cad sangs ma rgyas kyi bar du /
translated: And one vows as in the sutras and in other treatises.🔽Those of little desire vow to work for the welfare of sentient beings until all sentient beings have attained Buddhahood.

original: sems can gyi don byed cing 'grub par smon la /
analyzed: sems can gyi don byed cing 'grub par smon la /
translated: And they vow to attain Buddhahood.

original: mdo dang bstan bcos gzhan ltar yang smon no //
analyzed: mdo dang bstan bcos gzhan ltar yang smon no //
translated: And they vow as in the sutras and in other treatises.

original: rgyas pa chen por 'jeg rten gyi dge ba'i rgyu 'bras la yi rang zhing bsngos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyas pa chen por 'jeg rten gyi dge ba'i rgyu 'bras la yi rang zhing bsngos par 'gyur ro //
translated: They rejoice in the causes and effects of virtue in the world, and dedicate them to the Great Expansion.

original: nyams pa bcos pa'i thabs la gsum ste /
analyzed: nyams pa bcos pa'i thabs la gsum ste /
translated: The means of repairing transgressions has three parts:

original: nyams pa'i tshad dang / thabs dang / nyams pa bcos pa nyes par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nyams pa'i tshad dang / thabs dang / nyams pa bcos pa nyes par bstan pa'o //
translated: the measure of a transgression, the means of repairing it, and the teaching on the faults of not repairing a transgression.

original: tshad ni rtsa ba'i pham pa bzhi las bdag nyid rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la rab tu zhen nas bdag la bstod la gzhan la smod na pham pa dang po byung ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ni rtsa ba'i pham pa bzhi las bdag nyid rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la rab tu zhen nas bdag la bstod la gzhan la smod na pham pa dang po byung ba'o //
translated: The measure of a transgression: If, out of attachment to gain and honor, you praise yourself and disparage others, you have incurred the first root downfall.

original: bdag la nor zas yod pa la sdug bsngal la mgon med pa bkres pa sogs slong ba la snying sran gyis mi ster ba dang / dad pa dang / gus pa dang legs pas chos 'dod pa la snying mi brtse bas chos mi ster ba ste gnyis pa byung ba'o /
analyzed: bdag la nor zas yod pa la sdug bsngal la mgon med pa bkres pa sogs slong ba la snying sran gyis mi ster ba dang / dad pa dang / gus pa dang legs pas chos 'dod pa la snying mi brtse bas chos mi ster ba ste gnyis pa byung ba'o /
translated: The second is to have food and wealth oneself, but to be miserly and not give to those who are suffering, unprotected, hungry, and so on.

original: zhe sdang bdo nas gzhan la khros te 'thab mo stsogs kyis gzhan gyis bshags pa mi nyan par brdeg pa la sogs pa byed par zhe sdang pos 'chang na gsum pa byung ba'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang bdo nas gzhan la khros te 'thab mo stsogs kyis gzhan gyis bshags pa mi nyan par brdeg pa la sogs pa byed par zhe sdang pos 'chang na gsum pa byung ba'o //
translated: The third is to be angry and not listen to the apologies of others when one is angry with them and they quarrel and fight, but to hold on to one's anger and beat them and so on.

original: theg pa chen po'i sde snod 'gro ba skyob pa la skur pa 'debs shing gzhan gyis zhar la bcos pa'i chos ma yin pa la chos ltar ston tam nyan na /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i sde snod 'gro ba skyob pa la skur pa 'debs shing gzhan gyis zhar la bcos pa'i chos ma yin pa la chos ltar ston tam nyan na /
translated: If one denigrates the Mahāyāna canon, which protects beings, and teaches or listens to non-dharmas that are fabricated by others as if they were the Dharma,

original: byang chub sems dpa' pham pa bzhi pa byung ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' pham pa bzhi pa byung ba'o //
translated: a bodhisattva has incurred the fourth downfall.

original: yan lag ldom pa nyi shu pa ltar nyon mongs pa'i sems dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i sems kyis dkon mchog gsum gyi mchod ba la sogs pa'i sdom pa rnams so //
analyzed: yan lag ldom pa nyi shu pa ltar nyon mongs pa'i sems dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i sems kyis dkon mchog gsum gyi mchod ba la sogs pa'i sdom pa rnams so //
translated: The twenty-part version of the same text speaks of the vows of worship of the Three Jewels and so on, which are to be observed with a mind free of defilements and with a mind that is defiled.

original: bcos pa'i thabs dngos ni rtsa ba bzhi gang byung yang /
analyzed: bcos pa'i thabs dngos ni rtsa ba bzhi gang byung yang /
translated: The actual means of restoration:

original: nyon mongs pa drag po byung nas nyams pa sngon bzhin 'gyod pas blang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa drag po byung nas nyams pa sngon bzhin 'gyod pas blang /
translated: If you have broken a root vow because of strong defilements, you should take the vow again, as before, with regret.

original: nyon mongs pa 'bring na khrel yod pa ngo tsha shes nas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'bring na khrel yod pa ngo tsha shes nas /
translated: If the defilements were of medium strength, you should feel shame and embarrassment.

original: mkhas par @140b gnas pa gsum la bshags /
analyzed: mkhas par @140b gnas pa gsum la bshags /
translated: You should confess the fault to three learned and competent monks.

original: des kyang 'gyod dam zhes dri /
analyzed: des kyang 'gyod dam zhes dri /
translated: They should ask you, “Do you regret it?”

original: 'gyod do zhes lan gsum brjod cing phyin chad bsdam /
analyzed: 'gyod do zhes lan gsum brjod cing phyin chad bsdam /
translated: You should reply, “I do regret it,” three times, and you should promise to refrain from the action in the future.

original: nyon mongs pa chud na gcig po de'i drung du bshags so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa chud na gcig po de'i drung du bshags so //
translated: If the defilements were slight, you should confess the fault to one of the three monks.

original: 'gyod dam zhes pa dang 'gyod de zhes lan gsum dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'gyod dam zhes pa dang 'gyod de zhes lan gsum dri bar bya'o //
translated: They should ask you, “Do you regret it?” and you should reply, “I do regret it,” three times.

original: yan lag rnams byung na'ang de bzhin du bshags te /
analyzed: yan lag rnams byung na'ang de bzhin du bshags te /
translated: If you have broken a secondary vow, you should confess it in the same way.

original: nyes pa dang / nyes pa med pa'i khyad par sdom pa nyi shu pa'i 'grel pa nas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nyes pa dang / nyes pa med pa'i khyad par sdom pa nyi shu pa'i 'grel pa nas shes par bya'o //
translated: The difference between faults and non-faults should be understood from the commentary on the Twenty Verses.

original: nges pa bskyed pa la bcos pa dang / byed pa spo ba gnyis sam /
analyzed: nges pa bskyed pa la bcos pa dang / byed pa spo ba gnyis sam /
translated: There are two kinds of generating certainty: generating certainty through a substitute and generating certainty through a substitute and changing the action.

original: bcos pas nges pa bskyed pa ni ma ga dh'ar sh'a ri'i bus sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar sems bskyed nas bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri'i nub tu gsang ba gsum pa'i phug tu bsgoms pas bram ze gcig slong du byung ste /
analyzed: bcos pas nges pa bskyed pa ni ma ga dh'ar sh'a ri'i bus sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar sems bskyed nas bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri'i nub tu gsang ba gsum pa'i phug tu bsgoms pas bram ze gcig slong du byung ste /
translated: Generating certainty through a substitute is as follows: In Magadha, Shariputra generated the thought of awakening in the presence of the Buddha and meditated in the cave of the three secrets on the western side of Vulture Peak. A brahmin came to beg.

original: ci 'dod byas pas khyod kyi lag pa g-yas pa 'dod zer nas /
analyzed: ci 'dod byas pas khyod kyi lag pa g-yas pa 'dod zer nas /
translated: When asked, What do you want? he said, I want your right hand.

original: lag pa bcad nas g-yon pa'i khar bzhag nas byin pas ma 'dod nas /
analyzed: lag pa bcad nas g-yon pa'i khar bzhag nas byin pas ma 'dod nas /
translated: He cut off his hand, placed it in the brahmin's lap, and gave it. The brahmin did not want it.

original: ngas ni sems can gyi don mi 'ong ngo //
analyzed: ngas ni sems can gyi don mi 'ong ngo //
translated: He thought, I will not be able to benefit sentient beings.

original: blang zer nas byin pa yang mi 'dod pa snyam ste /
analyzed: blang zer nas byin pa yang mi 'dod pa snyam ste /
translated: He said, Take it, and gave it, but the brahmin did not want it. Thinking, I am in despair,

original: yi mug par gyur nas smon pa dad 'jug pa gnyis ka btang ba la /
analyzed: yi mug par gyur nas smon pa dad 'jug pa gnyis ka btang ba la /
translated: he gave up both the aspiration and the engagement.

original: sangs rgyas kyis nam mkha' nas tshigs su bcad pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis nam mkha' nas tshigs su bcad pa gsungs te /
translated: The Buddha spoke a verse from the sky:

original: thabs dang ldan pa byang chub sems //
analyzed: thabs dang ldan pa byang chub sems //
translated: The bodhisattva has the method.

original: thabs med pas na nyan thos te //
analyzed: thabs med pas na nyan thos te //
translated: The śrāvaka lacks the method.

original: khyod rang thabs la mi mkhas pas /
analyzed: khyod rang thabs la mi mkhas pas /
translated: You yourself are not skilled in the method.

original: g-yon pa mi 'dod mgos sbyin mod //
analyzed: g-yon pa mi 'dod mgos sbyin mod //
translated: You do not want the left, but you want the head.

original: ces brjod nas bram ze lag pa g-yon pa mi 'dod pa la g-yon pas ster ba rang gis nyes na ci la yi chad /
analyzed: ces brjod nas bram ze lag pa g-yon pa mi 'dod pa la g-yon pas ster ba rang gis nyes na ci la yi chad /
translated: Having said this, if you give the left hand to the brahman who does not want the left hand, what is the point of regretting your own mistake?

original: mgo thog tu bzhag la sbyin mod /
analyzed: mgo thog tu bzhag la sbyin mod /
translated: You should give it, placing it on top of your head.

original: de yang thabs la mkhas pas sangs rgyas bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang thabs la mkhas pas sangs rgyas bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, you should accomplish buddhahood through skillful means.

original: zhes gsungs pas slar 'gyod nas bslangs pas thob //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas slar 'gyod nas bslangs pas thob //
translated: Thus he spoke. Later, having generated regret, he asked for it back and obtained it.

original: rgyal po ma skyes dgras sems bskyed nas pha bsad de /
analyzed: rgyal po ma skyes dgras sems bskyed nas pha bsad de /
translated: King Ajātaśatru generated the thought of awakening, killed his father,

original: yang 'gyod nas slar blangs pas thob po //
analyzed: yang 'gyod nas slar blangs pas thob po //
translated: and later, having generated regret, asked for it back and obtained it.

original: mdo gzhan nas kyang blta ba ste /
analyzed: mdo gzhan nas kyang blta ba ste /
translated: It is also seen in other sūtras.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa gser dngul ltar bcos su btub pas nyams pa med de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa gser dngul ltar bcos su btub pas nyams pa med de /
translated: The bodhisattva vow is like gold or silver, which can be reshaped if damaged.

original: med pas spros pa la rgyu 'bras gnyis las //
analyzed: med pas spros pa la rgyu 'bras gnyis las //
translated: Since it is not nonexistent, it is not necessary to generate the two, cause and effect, through mental proliferation.

original: 'bras bu'i yon tan dpag tu med cing rtags mang bas 'dir brjod pas mi zad pas ma bstan te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i yon tan dpag tu med cing rtags mang bas 'dir brjod pas mi zad pas ma bstan te /
translated: Since the qualities of the result are immeasurable and the signs are many, they are not taught here because they are inexhaustible and cannot be expressed.

original: mdo gzhan na blta bar bya zhing shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo gzhan na blta bar bya zhing shes par bya'o //
translated: They should be seen and understood in other sūtras.

original: rgyu pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gzhan la bsngos pas tshogs lam la sbyor ba dang / @141a * //
analyzed: rgyu pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gzhan la bsngos pas tshogs lam la sbyor ba dang / @141a * //
translated: The result of the six causes, the perfections, and so on, is dedicated to others, so one is connected to the path of accumulation.

original: sbyor lam la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor lam la sbyor ba'o //
translated: One is connected to the path of preparation.

original: de'i rgyu 'bras chos thams cad rab tu mi gnas par shes pas mthong ba'i lam la spyor ba'o /
analyzed: de'i rgyu 'bras chos thams cad rab tu mi gnas par shes pas mthong ba'i lam la spyor ba'o /
translated: The cause of that is the understanding that all phenomena are utterly nonabiding, so one is connected to the path of seeing.

original: de rnams mi gnas par shes nas rgyun chad pa med pas bsgom pa'i lam la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams mi gnas par shes nas rgyun chad pa med pas bsgom pa'i lam la sbyor ba'o //
translated: Having understood that they are utterly nonabiding, one is connected to the path of meditation because there is no interruption.

original: de sems can gyi don du pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa ltar snang yang 'bras bu la re ba med pas mthar phyin pa'i lam la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de sems can gyi don du pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa ltar snang yang 'bras bu la re ba med pas mthar phyin pa'i lam la sbyor ba'o //
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, one practices the six perfections as if they were a mere appearance, but one is connected to the path of culmination because one has no hope for a result.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa la chos nor la chags pa med na sa dang po la sbyor ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa la chos nor la chags pa med na sa dang po la sbyor ro //
translated: If one is not attached to wealth and Dharma while practicing the six perfections, one is connected to the first bhūmi.

original: drug dang chags pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa med nas gnyis pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: drug dang chags pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa med nas gnyis pa la sbyor ro //
translated: and the sixth, and the absence of attachment and the absence of defilement, lead to the second.

original: drug dang ma chags pa dang / nyon mongs pa med nas zhe sdang med nas gsum pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: drug dang ma chags pa dang / nyon mongs pa med nas zhe sdang med nas gsum pa la sbyor ro //
translated: and the sixth, and the absence of attachment and the absence of defilement, and the absence of aversion, lead to the third.

original: de ltar snyom las med na bzhi pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: de ltar snyom las med na bzhi pa la sbyor ro //
translated: In this way, if one is not lazy, one is connected to the fourth.

original: de ltar dang / dal ba /
analyzed: de ltar dang / dal ba /
translated: In this way, and if one is not slow,

original: dben pa / zhi ba na lnga pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: dben pa / zhi ba na lnga pa la sbyor ro //
translated: and if one is secluded, and if one is peaceful, one is connected to the fifth.

original: de ltar bcu gsum pa dang / 'khrul pa bcad na drug pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: de ltar bcu gsum pa dang / 'khrul pa bcad na drug pa la sbyor ro //
translated: In this way, and if one is free from the thirteenth, and if one cuts through delusion, one is connected to the sixth.

original: de'i steng du skyon med na bdun pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: de'i steng du skyon med na bdun pa la sbyor ro //
translated: On top of that, if one is free from faults, one is connected to the seventh.

original: de'i steng du zhum pa med na brgyad pa la sbyor ro //🔽de'i steng du the tshom med na dgu pa la sbyor ro /
analyzed: de'i steng du zhum pa med na brgyad pa la sbyor ro // de'i steng du the tshom med na dgu pa la sbyor ro /
translated: On top of that, if one is free from discouragement, one is connected to the eighth.🔽On top of that, if one is free from doubt, one is connected to the ninth.

original: de'i steng du rmongs pa med na sa bcu pa la sbyor ro /
analyzed: de'i steng du rmongs pa med na sa bcu pa la sbyor ro /
translated: On top of that, if one is free from delusion, one is connected to the tenth stage.

original: 'bras bu lam dang gnas pa dngos kyis mdo las blta bar gyis shig / de ltar spyod lam du bya ba sems bskyed nas mdo sde pa dang / dbu ma pa'i bar du spyad pa la mid na 'dod pa la khyad med do //
analyzed: 'bras bu lam dang gnas pa dngos kyis mdo las blta bar gyis shig / de ltar spyod lam du bya ba sems bskyed nas mdo sde pa dang / dbu ma pa'i bar du spyad pa la mid na 'dod pa la khyad med do //
translated: Thus, having generated the thought of what is to be practiced in daily conduct, if one practices between the Sautrāntika and the Madhyamaka, there is no difference in assertion.

original: lta ba lnga ste /
analyzed: lta ba lnga ste /
translated: There are five views.

original: lnga char la re re ste /
analyzed: lnga char la re re ste /
translated: Each of the five is as follows.

original: mdo sde pa rten 'brel du yod de /
analyzed: mdo sde pa rten 'brel du yod de /
translated: The Sautrāntika is that things exist in interdependence.

original: dper na ras sngon po'i khar shel bzhag pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dper na ras sngon po'i khar shel bzhag pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: For example, it is like a crystal placed on top of blue cloth.

original: shes pa dang rnam pa rten 'brel yin /
analyzed: shes pa dang rnam pa rten 'brel yin /
translated: The consciousness and the aspect are interdependent.

original: ras kyis shel sngo ba sngo byed ras yin /
analyzed: ras kyis shel sngo ba sngo byed ras yin /
translated: The cloth makes the crystal blue.

original: de bzhin du ma yin nas tha dad na /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma yin nas tha dad na /
translated: If it were not like that, they would be different.

original: bye brag pa'i dge bas sems la mi phan pa dang // sdig pas sems la mi gnod de /
